programme.title: Posh Pawn
programme.desc: Boss James Constantinou and the team appraise more items brought along by members of the public. A divorcee from Newcastle wants to sell her £185,000 necklace to pay for her children's private-school fees, a crystal-covered drum kit used on a Kylie Minogue tour catches the eye of staff member Patrick, and a widowed pensioner hopes to make a fortune from her precious rings. Plus, a valuation doesn't come easy to the experts when a client turns up with a 7ft Terminator model.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawn
programme.desc: The high-end clients and luxury items continue to roll in, including a celebrity hat designer looking to sell her spectacular diamond-encrusted ruby necklace to raise funds to open a boutique. Paintings by East End gangsters the Kray twins cause a dilemma for the team, and MD James Constantinou tries out a water jet pack. Plus, fake watches lead to a bust-up among staff amid preparations for the grand opening of the flagship store.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer catch up with Hilary and Rob, who were looking for a family home in Hitchin, Hertfordshire, but were persuaded to widen the search and have been in their new property for little more than a year. There is also an update on first-time buyers Sundeep and Rupreet from Harrow, north-west London.(n)

programme.title: Double Your House for Half the Money
programme.sub-title: Sarah Beeny's Double Your House for Half the Money.
programme.desc: Multi-generational living is one of the fastest rising phenomena in UK housing today. In this edition, Sarah meets two families pooling their resources to bring relatives together under one roof. In Doddinghurst, Essex, Nina Osborne and her family all want to live in the house her grandfather built 40 years ago. They plan to create a modern mansion twice its size on a limited budget of £150,000. Meanwhile, Jamie and Shital have relocated from London to Sheffield and want to adapt their bungalow into a stylish home to cater for two of their loved ones as well as their own needs - Shital uses a wheelchair and Jamie has cerebral palsy.(n)

programme.title: Cheap Cheap Cheap
programme.desc: New series. Noel Edmonds hosts a game show set in a shop in which pairs of contestants win an increasing amount of money by correctly picking the cheapest of three similar items.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition kicks off at Abertay Guest House in the Dundee suburb of Broughty Ferry, where hosts Kate and Karlos Victor hope their home from home approach will win the day.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Mobile hairdresser Verene Farrell hosts the first dinner party in Barnsley, South Yorkshire. She offers a main course of kangaroo fillet with a confit of quandong and yakajirri rosti, hoping to impress part-time drag queen Christian Whiteley-Mason, businessman and wine enthusiast Phil Davies, novelist Milly Johnson and Paul Hoyle, a man known to his friends as Party Paul.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Paul Hoyle hosts the second dinner in Barnsley, South Yorkshire, and plans to live up to his party-boy reputation by preparing three types of entertainment for his guests. However, the mood turns sour when it is revealed one of the diversions calls for them to bring their swimwear.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Part-time drag queen Christian Whiteley-Mason hosts the third dinner party in Barnsley, South Yorkshire. He decides to spend the evening as his alter ego Lady Bacardi and dress one of the male guests as a woman, but the entertainment is not to everybody's taste.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Novelist Milly Johnson hosts the penultimate dinner party in Barnsley, South Yorkshire, and hopes her `hearts and flowers' theme will bring harmony back to the group following the previous night's confrontation. However, as soon as the evening gets under way, it is clear there is no love lost between Phil and Verene.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Wine and food snob Phil Davies host the final night in Barnsley, South Yorkshire, hoping to win the prize with an impressive menu prepared from scratch and a carefully selected wine to accompany each course. Unfortunately, his guests are not looking forward to the meal.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp is enlisted to help identical twins Matt and Chris Wickham buy their first home in north London, but a budget of £350,000 may not be enough to secure a property in their favoured areas of Pimlico and Victoria. Meanwhile, Phil Spencer offers advice to Sam Taylor and his fiancee Krystle Maher, who are keen to move from their rented flat in Deptford into a place of their own.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Danni Menzies tries to help software engineer Andy Forsyth and his partner Jacqui Monroe, who have decided the time is right to buy a second home on the island of Barbados.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Angie and Sandy from Nottingham are approaching retirement and looking for a place where they can spend quality time together. They've decided the sunshine of the southern Costa Blanca is the perfect place to do just that, so Ben Hillman shows them five properties for their £75,000 budget.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer catch up with two couples previously searching for their first homes together in London. Sarah and Ian wanted a house in their beloved Balham in the south-west of the city, while Louise and Matt had second thoughts about settling in the north-east, but both pairs were forced to alter their expectations and compromise on location.(n)

programme.title: Flights from Hell: Caught on Camera
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the extremes of human behaviour in airports and on planes. Footage includes angry missed check-ins to bizarre drunken antics at security, alternative safety briefings, deafening party flights and near-death experiences on flights from hell.(n)

programme.title: From Russia to Iran: Crossing the Wild Frontier
programme.desc: New series. Levison Wood travels across the Caucasus mountain range, which run for 2600 miles across five countries on the border between Europe and Asia. The expedition begins on Russia's heavily militarised southern border, where he has to avoid the local police. The first leg of the journey takes him through the ruins of ancient civilisations, the notorious former battleground of Chechnya, and the territory of Islamist terrorists.(n)

programme.title: Streetmate
programme.desc: New series. Scarlett Moffatt hosts a revival of the dating show, taking to the streets of Britain to unite single people. A personal trainer is on the hunt for a partner in Leeds.(n)

programme.title: Taxi of Mum and Dad
programme.desc: One-off documentary exploring the joys and challenges of parenting teenagers today from the one place where conversations are likely to take place - the family car. Eight cars have been rigged with multiple cameras, allowing viewers to eavesdrop on the conversations between parents and their children as they catch up and connect away from their home lives.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: New series. Jimmy Carr hosts the comedy panel show's version of the words-and-numbers quiz, with Jon Richardson and Cariad Lloyd taking on guest captain Alan Carr and Kevin Bridges. Elis James and John Robins join Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner, while Rachel Riley looks after the numbers and letters.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: A 79-year-old man arrives in hospital after collapsing in the street whilst walking his dog, and doctors give him medication to try and stabilise his very high heart rate. Meanwhile, a young boy is treated after pushing a plastic toy down his ear, and doctors show concern for a man who has numbness in his arm and little finger, and send him for a CT scan.(n)

programme.title: The Windsors
programme.desc: In the final episode of the second series, Charles announces he will become absolute monarch, as the new Magna Carta decrees. He just needs one world leader's endorsement, Donald Trump. Wills and Kate oppose the absolute monarchy, and Pippa's wedding day arrives, but will Harry let her go through with it? Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: The State
programme.desc: Jalal and Ziyaad experience bloody frontline battle when their unit is hit by a drone strike, while Shakira witnesses the horrifying aftermath of a barrel bomb and Ushna is shocked at the brutal treatment of women. Shakira must persuade a dangerous commander to set aside Isis rules and allow her to work in hospital and Jalal has a conversation that makes him question the whole rationale for his journey to Syria. Continues tomorrow.(n)

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Couples compete in Bognor Regis, West Sussex, with Carl and Brianha kicking off proceedings with an evening inspired by the glitz and glamour of the French Riviera. Day two sees down-to-earth couple Mark and Lisa cook up some collapsing fish cakes and a Thai curry that proves too hot for some. Finally it's Justin and Karen's turn with a fine dining menu that the pair are convinced will deliver them the £1,000 prize.(n)

programme.title: Kirstie's Vintage Gems
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp demonstrates how to create handmade and personalised gifts. She learns about sugarcraft and perfume-making, and also receives a lesson in the art of designing Victorian-style silhouettes.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawn
programme.desc: Prestige Pawnbrokers boss James Constantinou mixes business with pleasure as he heads to Spain to meet an entrepreneur friend who's looking to get a £100,000 loan on his luxury 18-metre yacht. A young widow finds it difficult to part with her late husband's vintage car to set up a new life in Croatia, jewellery expert Monika is shocked when she's asked to deal with a golden rat, and the shop staff struggle to put a price on some rare and problematic black coral statues.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawn
programme.desc: The arrival of a life-sized suit of armour and matching horse amuses staff at the new Hatton Garden shop, while MD James takes a trip down a canal on a barge that a businessman is looking to secure a loan against. A sunseeker hopes to sell some precious family jewellery to help fund a move to Spain, and Lawrence is faced with a mysterious wooden chest thought to have belonged to the royal family.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp is enlisted to help identical twins Matt and Chris Wickham buy their first home in north London, but a budget of £350,000 may not be enough to secure a property in their favoured areas of Pimlico and Victoria. Meanwhile, Phil Spencer offers advice to Sam Taylor and his fiancee Krystle Maher, who are keen to move from their rented flat in Deptford into a place of their own.(n)

programme.title: Double Your House for Half the Money
programme.sub-title: Sarah Beeney's Double Your House for Half the Money.
programme.desc: In Fleckney, Leicestershire, Sarah meets first-time renovators Steve and Hannah, who have recently bought a dilapidated 1970s property with the aim of extending, modernising and fixing it to create a multi-purpose, stylish house with home office. Unfortunately, as soon as the project begins, so too does the start of one of Britain's wettest winters on record. In the village of Great Missenden, Buckinghamshire, newlyweds James and Lucy have taken on the challenge of renovating and expanding an old two-bedroom semi into a four-bed country cottage.(n)

programme.title: Cheap Cheap Cheap
programme.desc: Delivery man Keith gets caught up in traffic, Barry and Noel try out a tandem ride, and a mother and daughter hope their knowledge of mini-rolls will help them win £25,000.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competitors visit The Registry Guest House in Peterculter, near Aberdeen. Here, owner Bob Calder and his sister-in-law Kirsty Laird hope to impress their fellow hoteliers.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Business development manager Juliet Eastham hosts the first of five dinner parties in Bury, and her belief in spirits from the afterlife proves to be a talking-point among her guests - schoolteacher James Perkin, burlesque dancer Nikki Salt, accountant Paula Skelton and waiter Ali McKernan.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Burlesque dancer Nikki Salt throws the second party in Bury, hoping her ready-made, retro American-style menu will impress her guests. Tensions rise around the dinner table when straight-talking Paula Skelton annoys the other diners, so the hostess tries to ease the mood by putting on a performance as her risque alter ego - Willow Blue.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Schoolteacher James Perkin hosts the third dinner party in Bury. He plans to cook all his favourite dishes, including a Sri Lankan curry which he learnt to make on his honeymoon, but he fears it may be too hot for his guests' palates. He also writes a limerick for each of the diners, but an argument between Paula and Juliet threatens to derail proceedings.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Waiter Ali McKernan hosts the penultimate dinner party in Bury and feels confident he can create a harmonious evening. Although his dog-biscuit appetiser leaves his guests bemused, he is sure his ukulele performance of a Britney Spears song will secure him victory.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Accountant Paula Skelton hosts the final evening in Bury, and begins her preparations by buying what she sees as the most important ingredient for a successful night - plenty of alcohol. When the other contestants arrive, her food receives a mixed reception, as does the introduction of her pet ferret, before they learn who has won the £1,000 prize.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer help find a property for first-time buyers Mike Richie and girlfriend Katy Roberts, who have recently returned from a 10-month period of globetrotting and want to settle down in Leeds. Meanwhile, Ann-Marie McCullough and partner Lee Connolly hope to swap life in the city for a three-bedroom period home, so the experts take them to Ilkley in West Yorkshire, and Harrogate in North Yorkshire.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Laura Hamilton advises Christine and Richard Turley, who are seeking to buy a holiday home in Portugal that they can share with their families. Working with a budget of £190,000, Laura shows them five properties close to the beaches of the Western Algarve, but will any meet their exacting standards?.(n)

programme.title: Kirstie and Phil's Love It or List It
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer go head to head as they meet fed-up families whose homes no longer fit their requirements. After listening to their issues, Phil tries to persuade the owners to sell and upgrade on the property market, while Kirstie argues that investing, either by extending or redesigning, is the wiser move. In the first programme, Paul and Dawn, their three children, and his twin 17-year-old daughters from a previous relationship, find their current home isn't working for them any longer. While Kirstie suggests a complete overhaul, Phil is doing what he does best and finds a selection of alternative properties.(n)

programme.title: Amazing Spaces Shed of the Year
programme.desc: New series. George Clarke presides over the 2017 Shed of the Year competition, beginning with the cabins and summerhouses category. Among the contenders are a mushroom-shaped shed and a pink and turquoise construction inspired by a Los Angeles pool house. This year's contest will feature a new category, for unusual sheds that push the boundaries of construction in ingenious ways.(n)

programme.title: The Gift
programme.desc: A man has a chance encounter with an old schoolfriend whom he does not remember. A series of troubling further meetings and mysterious presents bring dark secrets to light and leave his wife concerned about how little she knows about his past. Thriller, starring Rebecca Hall, Jason Bateman and Joel Edgerton, who also directed.(n)

programme.title: Streetmate
programme.desc: Scarlett Moffatt plays Cupid for Cardiff musician James, and in Cheltenham, she tries to find sales rep Charlotte a date with a great sense of humour.(n)

programme.title: Can't Pay? We'll Take It Away
programme.desc: Kevin Stokes and Brian O'Shaughnessy get into a doorstep confrontation with a debtor who wants to prove her family business is bankrupt. Elsewhere, Paul Bohill and Steve Pinner face evicting three properties owned by the same landlord in north London, and Brian and Delroy Anglin collect £2,000 debt owed to a vet in Kent.(n)

Plus, two agents try to recover £1,600 worth of goods from the owner of an entertainment company after a wedding day dispute, and in west London, a landlady is owned £9,000 in rent arrears by a young mother.(n)

programme.title: Can't Pay? We'll Take It Away
programme.desc: The agents try to recover more than £12,000 owed by a jeweller to one of his suppliers, but as the tension mounts, the debtor violently lashes out at one of the officers. Meanwhile, agents in London chase up more than £5,000 owed by a tenant to her former landlord for rent arrears, and also attempt to retrieve over £6,000 owed by a property developer.(n)

programme.title: Get Your Tatts Out: Kavos Ink
programme.desc: A pair of friends fresh off the plane head straight for the tattoo parlour, where they celebrate their love of herbal drugs with tattoos on their boobs. Another Brit decides that nothing sums up his Kavos holiday more than a tattoo of ex-boxer Mike Tyson's face.(n)

programme.title: South Park
programme.desc: Part two of two. Cartman accidentally wakes up 500 years in the future and finds himself in the middle of warring factions. With the voices of Trey Parker and Matt Stone.(n)

programme.title: South Park

programme.title: Morgan

programme.title: Gods of Egypt

programme.title: Sudden Impact
programme.desc: The fourth film in Clint Eastwood's popular Dirty Harry series. Detective Harry Callahan is sent to a seaside town to investigate his latest case, only to discover a new and unlikely suspect(n)

programme.title: The Mummy
programme.desc: Brits John Hannah and Rachel Weisz join Brendan Fraser for this tongue-in-cheek action adventure romp. Special effects dominate the screen as a team of archaeologists unleashes the spirit of The Mummy, a demonic force that could well destroy the whole of mankind. Fraser stars as hunky chancer Rick O'Connell, who winds up helping beautiful Egyptologist Evie Carnahan and her clumsy brother Jonathan on their latest dig. But when The Mummy is accidentally reawakened, the future of the entire world is placed in jeopardy(n)

programme.title: Youth
programme.desc: Two aging friends, one a retired composer and the other a filmmaker working on a new project, go on vacation together at a spa resort in the Alps. There, they take stock of their lives and reflect on their artistic accomplishments(n)

programme.title: Shattered Glass
programme.desc: Hayden Christensen puts down his light saber to deliver a fine performance in this engrossing, fact-based tale of journalist Stephen Glass, whose up-and-coming career came to a screeching halt when it was discovered that he fabricated stories. Peter Sarsgaard, Chloe Sevigny, Rosario Dawson, Hank Azaria(n)

programme.title: Auto Focus
programme.desc: The life and sordid, untimely death of Hogan's Heroes star Bob Crane are explored by director Paul Schrader in this biopic, which marks one of the few times the filmmaker has not scripted his own film. Auto Focus chronologically traces the meteoric rise of Crane's show business career, beginning with his early success as a jokey deejay on Los Angeles morning radio in the early '60s. A devout family man, Crane lives in Southern Californian comfort with his wife Anne (Rita Wilson) and their young children, relishing the modicum of celebrity his job provides him. His life begins to change, however, when his agent Lenny (Ron Leibman) proposes that he take a breakthrough role on the CBS POW-camp sitcom Hogan's Heroes. Initially reluctant to take the job, Crane signs on with the production and, to his and everyone else's surprise, the show becomes a smash hit. With celebrity comes a new set of friends, and Crane falls in with audio-visual guru John Carpenter (Willem Dafoe), a Sony sales rep who spends his days setting up home entertainment systems for the Hollywood elite, and his nights cruising strip clubs for anonymous sexual encounters. Already a pornography buff, Crane starts using his fame to secure him and Carpenter an endless parade of affairs, which they videotape and then obsessively review. It isn't long before Anne demands a divorce, and Crane marries his Hogan's co-star Patti Olsen (aka Sigrid Valdis, here played by Maria Bello), who's more accepting of his escapades. When the sitcom is canceled, however, Crane has trouble securing acting jobs, and recedes further and further into his life of amateur porn with Carpenter. Auto Focus premiered at the Telluride and Toronto Film Festivals before its art-house run in the fall of 2002(n)

programme.title: Mafia!
programme.desc: As the story of the Cortino family unfolds over nearly a century, young Vincenzo is driven from his home and forced to swim to America!There he grows up to become the patriarch of an infamous crime family(n)

programme.desc: A sheltered young high society woman joins the army on a whim and finds herself in a more difficult situation than she ever expected(n)

programme.title: Suffragette
programme.desc: In this galvanizing feminist drama, a working-class laundress (Carey Mulligan) in 19th century London becomes radicalized when she meets a brave cadre of women organizing to obtain the vote(n)

programme.title: The Sisterhood of the Traveling Pants 2
programme.desc: With unraveled embroidery and fraying hems, the Pants are back for another glorious summer that four now college-aged friends will never forget in The Sisterhood of the Traveling Pants 2(n)

programme.title: Australia
programme.desc: Set against the scenic backdrop of pre-World War II Australia, Baz Luhrmann's romantic period adventure stars Nicole Kidman as an English aristocrat who inherits a sprawling ranch, and Hugh Jackman as the rough-and-tumble cattle driver who helps protect her property from greedy English cattle barons. As the pair attempt to herd 2,000 head of cattle hundreds of miles across the treacherous Australian outback, they are stunned to bear witness to the bombing of Darwin by Japanese forces -- who just a few months prior launched a devastating attack on Pearl Harbor(n)

programme.title: Off Air
programme.desc: Off Air(n)

programme.title: To Wong Foo, Thanks for Everything! Julie Newmar
programme.desc: Patrick Swayze plays Vida Boheme, a classy and long-reigning drag queen. With his understudy Noxeema Jackson (Wesley Snipes), Vida wins a New York drag stage contest and an all-expenses-paid trip to Hollywood. But when Miss Chi Chi Rodriguez (John Leguizamo) cries at having lost the contest, soft-hearted Vida cashes in the airline tickets so the three of them can take a car out West. The film becomes a strange sort of buddy road movie, with the three cross-dressers traveling across the American heartland in a shiny yellow Cadillac. First they tangle with Sheriff Dollard (Chris Penn). He stops them for a minor traffic violation, puts the moves on Vida, and Vida knocks him out, so they flee. Later, they are stranded by car problems in a small town in Nebraska. Renting a room in a hotel, they put some life into the town and its annual strawberry festival. They provide a mousy local woman, Carol Ann (Stockard Channing), with new role models of assertiveness. They also insist on chivalrous treatment from the local good old boys and give lessons on courting to a teenage girl. This film was released on the heels of the more outrageous Australian film The Adventures of Priscilla, Queen of the Desert, which featured Terence Stamp as a drag queen(n)

programme.title: Waterworld
programme.desc: Big-budget action fantasy starring Kevin Costner about the battle for survival in a world where dry land has disappeared with the melting of the polar ice caps. An amphibious loner, 'The Mariner', tries to protect survivors on an artificial atoll made from scrap metal by taking on a gang of marauding pirates. He is also intent on discovering if there is any truth in the myth that there is still some land left above water(n)

programme.title: The Green Mile
programme.desc: Tom Hanks is the head guard of Death Row who just wants life for him, his colleagues and the condemned to be nice and easy, but when Michael Clarke Duncan, a man-mountain convicted of murdering two little white girls, arrives, things start to get strange - how can he cure Hanks' urinary infection with a touch, bring a dead pet mouse back to life and cure the warden's wife's cancer? Is he innocent? And what will happen when his moment of execution arrives?(n)

programme.title: We Were Soldiers
programme.desc: The first major battle of the Vietnam War in 1965, and the soldiers who were involved, are depicted in this drama(n)

programme.title: Point Break
programme.desc: A young FBI agent, Johnny Utah, infiltrates a cunning team of thrill-seeking elite athletes who are led by the charismatic Bodhi. The athletes are suspected of carrying out a spate of crimes in extremely unusual ways. Deep undercover, and with his life in imminent danger, Utah strives to prove they are the architects of a string of inconceivable crimes(n)

programme.title: The Aviator
programme.desc: Oscar-winning biopic spanning a twenty-year period in the life of eccentric millionaire Howard Hughes, including the films, the women and his pioneering success as a world-class aviator. Visually stunning drama(n)

programme.title: Reign Of Fire
programme.desc: A survivalist teams up with a military man to slay fire-breathing dragons in postapocalyptic 2020(n)

programme.title: Three Kings
programme.desc: Three stars team up for this unusual look at America's role in the war against Iraq. In 1991, as the Gulf War winds to a close, three American servicemen find themselves happy to have achieved victory but wondering about the ultimate importance of what they've done (especially since Saddam Hussein is still in power). Major Archie Gates (George Clooney) is a decorated Vietnam veteran and special forces officer with two weeks to go before he retires; Sgt. Troy Barlow (Mark Wahlberg) has a new baby at home; and Chief Elgin (Ice Cube) is probably just going to end up back in Detroit. So when one of them comes across a map that seems to point out where Saddam's forces have stashed a large cache of gold they stole from Kuwait, they decide to follow the trail and take some of the war booty for themselves. However, the deeper they journey into Iraq, the more they see of the consequences of America's policies in the Middle East. Although President George Bush and the American military urged Iraqi citizens to rise up against Saddam Hussein, and pledged their support to a people's movement against the leader, Iraqis found that when they took to the streets against Saddam, the United States did not back them up, and the loss of Iraqi lives was fearsome. When Gates, Barlow and Elgin become aware of what's happening, they're torn between their desire to grab the fortune they came for and the demands of their conscience to help the people they came to liberate. Three Kings was directed by David O. Russell and marked a significant change of direction after his dark-humored relationship comedies, Spanking the Monkey and Flirting with Disaster(n)

programme.title: Wanted
programme.desc: Night Watch director Timur Bekmambetov helms his first English-language feature film with this big-screen adaptation of Mark Millar's action-packed graphic novel. Wesley Gibson (James McAvoy) is a cube-dwelling hypochondriac whose uneventful life has become a mundane blur of terminal boredom. Repeatedly humiliated by his boss and constantly cuckolded by his cheating girlfriend, weakling Wes seems to be living right down to everyone's expectations that he would never amount to anything in life. However, upon discovering that the father he never knew has been brutally murdered, the spineless, clock-punching pushover is recruited into a secret society of assassins known as the Fraternity. During the course of his training, the man who was once an office-bound wimp develops lightning-fast reflexes and superhuman dexterity courtesy of his skilled mentor Fox (Angelina Jolie). Upon completing his training, Wes is assigned the task of dealing out death to the mythological Fates, who possess the ability to alter the lifelines of mortal men. It isn't long before the nebbish nerd-turned-agile assassin is erasing the bad guys with surprising efficiency, yet as Wes begins to carry the mantle passed down to him by his father, he gradually begins to suspect that his wise tutors are not the crime-fighting enforcers they present themselves to be. Now, with everything he ever wanted in life finally within his grasp, Wes is about to find out that the only thing more difficult than ending the lives of others is summoning the courage to take control of his own(n)

The duo single out three suspects, but learn vital information has been stolen, and realise the whole Persian Gulf Fleet could be in danger.(n)

Crime drama, starring David Caruso and Emily Procter.(n)

programme.desc: No Laughing Matter. Hawkeye bets B.J. he can go jokeless for a day; Charles confronts the colonel (Robert Symonds) who banished him to Korea. Rosie: Eileen Saki. Korean Woman: Mae Hi. Korean Man: Nathan Jung. Nurse: Enid Kent. Hawkeye: Alan Alda. B.J.: Mike Farrell. Charles: David Ogden Stiers. Directed by Burt Metcalfe(n)

programme.title: M*A*S*H
programme.desc: Oh, How We Danced. B.J. (Mike Farrell) is hardly in a festive mood as his wedding anniversary approaches. What Beej doesn't know is that 4077th plans to throw him a surprise party--with a bit of home-movie input from his wife Peg (Catherine Bergstrom) and a dash of audiotape subterfuge from Hawkeye (Alan Alda) and Klinger (Jamie Farr). Elsewhere, the persnickety Charles (David Ogden Stiers) conducts a sanitary inspection at the front, and the camp extends its combined compassion to a wounded Korean youngster(n)

programme.title: Troy
programme.desc: A tale of romance, betrayal and power set in 1193 BC, Troy. The love-struck Prince of Troy has fallen for the Queen of Sparta, angering the king, whose brother uses this love triangle against him in an effort to gain more power(n)

programme.title: Avatar
programme.desc: A paraplegic ex-marine finds a new life on the distant planet of Pandora, only to find himself battling humankind alongside the planet's indigenous Na'vi race in this ambitious digital 3D sci-fi epic from Academy Award-winning Titanic director James Cameron. The film, which marks Cameron's first dramatic feature since 1997's Titanic, follows Jake Sully (Sam Worthington), a war veteran who gets called to the depths of space to pick up the job of his slain twin brother for the scientific arm of a megacorporation looking to mine the planet of Pandora for a valued ore. Unfortunately the biggest deposit of the prized substance lies underneath the home of the Na'vi, a ten-foot-tall, blue-skinned native tribe who have been at war with the security arm of the company, lead by Col. Miles Quaritch (Stephen Lang). Because of the planet's hostile atmosphere, humans have genetically grown half-alien/half-human bodies which they can jack their consciousnesses into and explore the world in. Since Jake's brother already had an incredibly expensive Avatar grown for him, he's able to connect with it using the same DNA code and experience first-hand the joys of Pandora while giving the scientific team, led by Grace Augustine (Sigourney Weaver) and Norm Spellman (Joel David Moore), some well-needed protection against the planet's more hostile forces. On a chance meeting after getting separated from his team, Jake's Avatar is rescued by Neytiri (Zoe Saldana), a Na'vi princess, who brings him into her tribe in order to give the humans a second chance at relating to this new environment. When word gets out of his increasing time with the alien species, Quaritch enlists Jake to do some reconnaissance for the company, as they'd like to persuade the tribe to move their home before taking more drastic measures to harness the treasure hidden below. Yet as Jake becomes one with the tribe and begins to understand the secrets of Pandora, his conscience is torn between his new adopted world and the wheelchair-bound one awaiting him when the psychic connection to his Avatar is broken. Soon battle lines are drawn and Jake needs to decide which side he will fight on when the time comes. The film was shot on the proprietary FUSION digital 3D cameras developed by Cameron in collaboration with Vince Pace, and offers a groundbreaking mix of live-action dramatic performances and computer-generated effects. The revolutionary motion-capture system created for the film allows the facial expressions of actors to be captured as a virtual camera system enables them to see what their computer-generated counterparts will be seeing in the film, and Peter Jackson's Oscar-winning Weta Digital visual-effects house supervises Avatar's complex special effects(n)

programme.title: Armageddon
programme.desc: Sci-fi thriller in which the American government discovers that it has just 18 days to save the world from an approaching asteroid. Undeterred by the threat of extinction, a brave though motley crew of oil drillers sets out to intercept the object and plant nuclear devices in its core(n)

programme.title: Black Hawk Down
programme.desc: Gritty war drama based on the true story of a botched US Army mission in Somalia during the early 1990s. US Army Rangers parachute into Mogadishu in an attempt to capture a warlord's two top lieutenants, but the operation goes disastrously wrong when a pair of helicopters are shot down. (Including five News Update)(n)

programme.title: Total Recall
programme.desc: Construction worker Douglas Quaid opts to enjoy a virtual holiday via implanted memories but the procedure awakens recollections of a former identity leading him on a dangerous mission to Mars(n)

programme.title: Rambo
programme.desc: Revival of the bloody military action series. The eponymous commando is coaxed out of retirement to act as a guide to a group of aid workers on a humanitarian mission in Burma. However, when the Burmese army captures the group, he mounts a violent one-man rescue mission to try to save the missionaries(n)

programme.title: Clash of the Titans
programme.desc: In this fantasy adventure based on Greek mythology, a courageous warrior named Perseus vows to defeat Hades in order to prevent the god of the underworld from overthrowing Zeus, thereby turning Earth into a living hell. A man of godly origins, Perseus watched in agony as Hades took his family, but now, with a small band of warriors by his side, he battles mythical creatures while tapping into his god-like abilities to take control of his own fate(n)

programme.title: Pompeii
programme.desc: A slave has an affair with his master's daughter as Mount Vesuvius prepares to erupt in A.D. 79(n)

programme.title: Good Morning, Vietnam
programme.desc: Drama based on the true story of US DJ Adrian Cronauer, who arrives in Saigon to take over the morning show on Armed Forces radio in 1965 and boost morale with his quickfire wit. But his superiors are not amused by his disregard for authority and his fondness for R & B records, especially poker-faced, polka-playing Lt Hauk. Williams's largely improvised performance earned him an Oscar nomination(n)

programme.title: The Young Messiah
programme.desc: As his family travel from Egypt to Nazareth, a 7-year-old Jesus wishes to learn more about his identity and place in the world in this stirring biblical drama. Meanwhile, Herod Antipas dispatches a Roman centurion to kill the boy, whose miraculous powers might be a threat to his reign(n)

programme.title: The Darkness
programme.desc: During a family camping trip at the Grand Canyon, a young boy stumbles upon an ancient Native American burial ground. He takes five sacred stones from there back to his suburban home, unaware that they contain a malevolent supernatural force(n)

programme.title: Undercover Brother
programme.desc: Undercover Brother began life as an animated series on the Internet. The satirical cartoon was created by novelist and screenwriter John Ridley (Three Kings) for the website /urbanentertainment.com. Ridley wrote the screenplay with Michael McCullers, co-writer of the Austin Powers sequels, and it was directed by Malcolm D. Lee (Spike Lee's cousin, and the writer/director of The Best Man). The film stars Eddie Griffin (of TV's Malcolm and Eddie) as Undercover Brother, he of the gold Cadillac convertible and huge Afro, who uses gadgets and disguises to steal from the rich and give to the poor. His activities are discovered by the B.R.O.T.H.E.R.H.O.O.D., a spy organization devoted to subverting The Man (Robert Trumbull) and his henchman, Mr. Feather (Chris Kattan), who use their power over the media to demean black people and destroy racial unity. The spy organization is run by The Chief (Chi McBride), who is constantly screaming at his subordinates. They include Sistah Girl (Aunjanue Ellis), a beautiful martial artist, Conspiracy Brother (Dave Chappelle), who sees white supremacist plots everywhere, and Smart Brother (Gary Anthony Williams, who provided the voice of Undercover Brother in the cartoon), who supplies the operatives with gadgets and information. When a popular black political figure, General Boutwell (Billy Dee Williams), calls a press conference, presumably to announce his presidential candidacy, and instead announces that he's opening a chain of fried chicken restaurants, the B.R.O.T.H.E.R.H.O.O.D. rightly suspects foul play, and recruits Undercover Brother to look into it. He goes undercover as an uptight buppie to work for The Man, but his cover is soon blown, and the seductive White She Devil (Denise Richards) is sent in to use her feminine wiles to destroy Undercover Brother(n)

programme.title: Puerto Ricans in Paris
programme.desc: Two Puerto Rican NYC cops (Luis Guzman and Edgar Garcia) are asked by a pair of French fashion designers (Alice Taglioni and Frederic Anscombre) to come to Paris to hunt down the counterfeiters who stole a couture handbag. Rosie Perez and Rosario Dawson co-star. Directed by Ian Edelman(n)

programme.title: Traders
programme.desc: A man's business goes under, threatening to derail his posh existence. In a desperate attempt to keep his life as he knows it, he agrees to cash out his entire life savings and put it all on the line in a diabolical, winner-takes-all fight to the death(n)

programme.title: Bug
programme.desc: William The Exorcist Friedkin's horror film stars Ashley Judd as Agnes, a waitress in a run-down bar who lives in a cheap motel. Into her life comes drifter Peter who, having served in the Gulf war, is obsessed with the idea that he is infected by bugs implanted by the government during medical treatment. She begins to share his paranoia and the pair spiral into a violent conspiracy theory which sees them become violently delusional to the point of extreme self-harm as they battle the bugs they believe are within them. Based on Tracy Letts' play from Chicago's Steppenwolf theatre, this is a visceral, frightening film but one that maintains an empathy for its characters up to the apocalyptic finale(n)

programme.title: The Terminator
programme.desc: A futuristic cyborg is sent to present-day Los Angeles to assassinate a woman, who will bear the child who will someday save humanity(n)

programme.title: The Mummy Returns
programme.desc: Fantasy sequel. Evil mummy Imhotep returns to wreak havoc as he resumes his relentless search for power and immortality. To make matters worse, another ancient evil has been unleashed, even more dangerous than Imhotep. Only the heroic Rick O'Connell and his intrepid Egyptologist wife Evelyn stand in the way of these twin terrors, and they embark upon a desperate mission to save the world(n)

programme.title: Midnight Special
programme.desc: In this captivating sci-fi adventure, Roy rescues his son Alton from a cult in Texas, whose members worship the boy for his supernatural powers. Along with a state trooper, the pair go on a cross-country journey as they are hunted by federal agents, who believe Alton might be a threat to national security(n)

programme.title: The Ninth Gate
programme.desc: An authority on rare books is drawn into a confrontation with the forces of darkness in this thriller directed by Roman Polanski. Dean Corso (Johnny Depp) is a rare book broker who makes his living tracking down valuable items for rich bibliophiles. Corso is hired by Boris Balkan (Frank Langella), a millionaire New Yorker with a vast collection of occult literature and a keen interest in "The Nine Gates to the Kingdom of Shadows." Legend has it that the book was co-written by Satan in the 17th century, and only three copies are known to exist; the owner of one recently sold the book to Balkan a few days before killing himself. Balkan wants Corso to find the other two copies (one owned by a Mr. Fargas in Portugal and the other by a French collector named Kessler) and examine them to determine if they are forgeries. Corso is told to be thorough and spare no expense. He begins by visiting Liana Telfer (Lena Olin), the widow of the man who once owned Balkan's copy of the book, who has an unusually strong desire to get the book back, and confers with his friend Bernie (James Russo), who soon turns up dead, in a manner much like an illustration from the book. Corso learns that the book contains clues to a puzzle that will allow people to call up the devil, and certain people will stop at nothing to find the missing parts of the formula(n)

programme.title: Gods of Egypt
programme.desc: A thief enlists the help of mythical Egyptian gods to overthrow a vicious ruler(n)

programme.title: Mr. Right
programme.desc: Martha finally finds her Mr Right, but he has just one flaw: he is a hitman on the run from his former employers, a crime cartel(n)

programme.title: Stir of Echoes
programme.desc: Supernatural thriller in which a man who suffers traumatic visions after being hypnotised becomes embroiled in a harrowing investigation into the mysterious disappearance of a local girl. As his daily life is increasingly overwhelmed by the psychic experiences, his young son is the only one to understand his terror. And as he attempts to unravel the strange clues surrounding his dreams, his own family is placed in danger(n)

programme.title: Magnum Force
programme.desc: The second action thriller in the Dirty Harry series sees the maverick cop investigating the slaying of some of the West Coast's most powerful criminals. Dismissing the theory that the murders are the result of underworld squabbling, Callahan learns that each of the victims was killed by a slug from a .357 Magnum - the most powerful handgun in the world, and a weapon widely used within the San Francisco Police Dept(n)

programme.title: Adam Sandler's Eight Crazy Nights
programme.desc: Festive cheer with Adam Sandler providing the voices in this animated comedy. It's almost Christmas and ex-basketball star Davey Stone has hit the skids. He's drinking himself into oblivion and his antics have landed him in front of a judge. Sentenced to community service, Davey is forced to coach a school basketball team. Can a pint-sized basketball referee called Whitey help this modern-day 'grinch' to change his ways and learn some valuable lessons about the festive period? Also features the voices of Rob Schneider and Tyra Banks(n)

programme.title: Mafia!
programme.desc: As the story of the Cortino family unfolds over nearly a century, young Vincenzo is driven from his home and forced to swim to America!There he grows up to become the patriarch of an infamous crime family(n)

programme.title: 2 Fast 2 Furious
programme.desc: Paul Walker returns as former cop Brian O'Connor who teams up with his ex-con pal Roman Pearce to transport a shipment of 'dirty' money for shady Miami-based import-export dealer Carter Verone, while actually working with undercover agent Monica Clemente to bring Verone down(n)

programme.title: The Mummy: Tomb of the Dragon Emperor
programme.desc: Explorer Rick O'Connell and his wife Evelyn are asked by the British government to take a magical diamond back to China. Unfortunately the jewel has the power to resurrect the evil Emperor Han, who long ago was transformed into a mummy along with his cut-throat army of soldiers. Soon the race is on to prevent Han from returning to life and taking over the world(n)

programme.title: Ride Along 2
programme.desc: Friction continues between a rookie cop and his seasoned partner (who's also his future brother-in-law). After discovering a mysterious flash drive during an arrest, the pair travel to Miami to hunt down a drug lord with the help of a savvy detective(n)

programme.title: Death Race
programme.desc: Jason Statham leads the cast of this high-octane action-thriller set in the post-industrial wasteland of tomorrow, with the world's most brutal sporting event as its backdrop. A penitentiary full of felons has inspired the jailers to create a grisly pastime ripe for lucrative kickbacks. Now, adrenalised inmates, a global audience hungry for televised violence and a spectacular arena come together to form the Death Race. From expert action director Paul W.S. Anderson and the producers of Mission: Impossible comes Death Race! The stakes don't get any higher than this!(n)

programme.title: Black Mass
programme.desc: This crime drama based on true events follows the rise and fall of South Boston gangster James "Whitey" Bulger, who was convinced by an FBI agent to act as an informant against the Italian mob. With his main competition out of the way, Bulger assumes power and becomes a feared crime boss(n)

programme.title: Rendition
programme.desc: Gavin Hood's thriller stars Reese Witherspoon as Isabella Fields El-Ibrahimi, the wife of American-Egyptian chemical engineer Anwar El-Ibrahimi. When Anwar disappears on his way home from a conference in South Africa, she is driven frantic trying to find proof of his whereabouts in the face of official denial. Anwar is being held as a suspected terrorist in secrecy in Marrakech, where CIA operative Douglas Freeman is reluctantly involved in his torture. Meanwhile, one of the torturer's daughters, Fatima, is secretly in love with a fellow student who may be following extreme paths. As Hood brings the strands together, the various characters' actions intertwine, moving towards a dramatic conclusion(n)

programme.title: From Hell
programme.desc: Johnny Depp plays an opium-addicted inspector who uses his clairvoyant powers to try to track down Jack the Ripper in 19th-century London(n)

programme.title: Rules of Engagement
programme.desc: Courtroom drama in which two US marines who fought together in war are reunited in a battle against the military. When one of the men is threatened with court martial for his involvement in the death of 83 civilians, he calls on his former colleague, who is embittered by his Vietnam injuries, to act as his attorney. As the men seek revenge against the military system, a high-level political conspiracy unravels(n)

programme.title: Right at Your Door
programme.desc: In the wake of the detonation of a 'dirty bomb' in LA and under the instruction of a public service announcement, Brad barricades himself within his home. With his wife Lexi on her way to work, he desperately tries to call her in an attempt to find out if she is safe and well. As time elapses and his worse fear looks set to manifest, Lexi appears outside the family home. If he allows his wife inside, he risks contaminating the house with deadly germs..(n)

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Jay's world crumbles around him as Phil makes a shocking revelation about the past that forces him to question everything. As Phil attempts to offer an explanation, a livid Jay struggles to comprehend the revelation and as the anger builds, his fury boils over.(n)

programme.title: Damilola, Our Loved Boy
programme.desc: In November 2000, 10-year-old schoolboy Damilola Taylor was attacked and fatally wounded in Peckham, south London, a death that shocked the nation. This feature-length drama reveals the personal stories behind the headlines, exploring Damilola's journey from Lagos to London, and showing how Richard and Gloria Taylor coped with their personal lives as well as the pressure of the media as they fought for justice for the killing of their son. Babou Ceesay, Wunmi Mosaku and Sammy Kamara star, with Robert Pugh.(n)

programme.title: Have I Got Old News for You
programme.desc: Gary Lineker hosts an edition of the satirical quiz from December 2016, with comedian Jon Richardson and a handbag representing absent MP Nicky Morgan joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the week's news.(n)

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.sub-title: Have I Got a Bit More Old News For You.
programme.desc: A compilation of the popular news quiz looking back at the big events of 2016, featuring team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton and a variety of guest hosts and panellists.(n)

programme.title: My Family, Partition and Me: India 1947
programme.desc: Part two of two. Anita Rani begins her own Partition journey, as she and her mother Lucky become the first members of her family to return to see what is now Pakistan, since the Partition of India. In the Punjabi village where her Sikh grandfather's first family were slaughtered, Anita meets locals who were eye witnesses to the terrible event. Across the border, Sameer Butt re-traces the epic train journey across the Punjab to Pakistan, and Binita Kane explores how her Hindu family managed to escape the violence that engulfed their Bengali village.(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer

programme.title: Heir Hunters

programme.desc: Footage of near misses caught on CCTV, featuring a delivery van smashing into a couple's home and trapping them in their bedroom and the water ski jumper who got it wrong at take off and hit the water at 70mph. Presented by Alex Jones.(n)

programme.desc: Two teams of married couples look for items at the Royal Highland Centre in Ingliston, Edinburgh, with help from experts Kate Bliss and Ben Cooper. Thomas Plant presents.(n)

programme.title: Impossible
programme.desc: Rick Edwards hosts a game show in which 30 recurring players compete for a daily prize of up to £1,500 and the chance to win £10,000. Every right answer takes them a step closer to a shot at that jackpot - but a single `impossible' answer knocks them out for the day.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Continent
programme.desc: Anita Rani helps a well-travelled London couple with a budget of £500,000 to find a new home in the southern French region of Provence, where they hope to combine business with pleasure. Anita offers advice on moving abroad, and delves into the rich history of the city of Avignon, which has been declared a UNESCO World Heritage Site.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: People are invited to try to make money out of their antiques by taking a risk at auction.(n)

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which pairs of contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman.(n)

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Another mix of nationwide reports and live studio-based chat, hosted by Matt Baker and Alex Jones.(n)

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Fi grows frustrated as Linda continues to undermine her decisions and Jack is made to think about his recent behaviour and apologises to Honey. Steven is alarmed when Max warns him he may need his help once more, while Phil tries to find Jay after he fails to turn up for work once again.(n)

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Oliver struggles with the thought that Tara's death could have been prevented, and Zosia is offered a chance to advance her career. Meanwhile, Lofty worries that Dominic still has feelings for him and contemplates how to let him down gently.(n)

programme.title: Trust Me
programme.desc: Following his discovery, Andy has a decision to make, and after Ally says goodbye to her dying father in Sheffield, a fatal error at work backs her into a corner. Drama, starring Jodie Whittaker, Emun Elliott and Sharon Small.(n)

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: While Brian spends time at home making peace with himself over his dismissal, he agrees to help Esther's friend Margaret find her missing brother Peter, in the interest of keeping his mind active. Peter was the accountant of a man who has gone to prison for the murder of his wife, so Brian visits the convict hoping he will be able to assist. However, his investigation begins to encroach on the Ucos team's efforts to track down a conman who may be connected to several outstanding cases. With Rosalind Ayres and Art Malik.(n)

programme.title: Land of the Giants
programme.desc: Sue Perkins narrates a documentary shining a light on the world of people who grow outsize vegetables, following them from March to August as they gear up for the first big competition of the season at the Vale of Glamorgan Agricultural Show. Part of the Our Lives strand.(n)

programme.title: The World's Most Photographed
programme.desc: An examination of movie icon Marilyn Monroe's love affair with the camera, revealing how photography gave her the reassurance she craved when the pressure of the Hollywood machine threatened to overwhelm her. The documentary profiles the work of photographer Sam Shaw, who captured the early, happy days of her marriage to Arthur Miller and was responsible for setting up the famous billowing skirt shot for The Seven Year Itch.(n)

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: Probate detectives discover a surprise connection to gun-making in Birmingham, while searching for the beneficiaries to a £100,000 estate. The case of a west London man with Indian ancestry, proves a major challenge for the team.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Ben Cooper and Gary Pe help the contestants seek out items of value in Peterborough to sell for profit at auction. Presenter Natasha Raskin Sharp also visits the town's lido and hears about strongman Walter Cornelius, a local legend.(n)

programme.title: Super Small Animals
programme.desc: Patrick Aryee investigates the world of miniature creatures, from a primate no bigger than a mouse to a chameleon that can fit on a human fingertip, finding out what makes them some of the most successful animals on the planet. He reveals how the smallest armadillo manages to control its temperature in the searing desert sun, and meets a scientist who studies how really tiny spiders have a surprising trick that enables them to travel an incredible 40 miles a day using almost no energy.(n)

programme.title: Victoria Derbyshire
programme.desc: Daily news and current-affairs programme offering discussion of breaking stories, exclusive interviews and audience interaction via social media.(n)

programme.title: BBC Newsroom Live
programme.desc: A chance to stay up to date on the day's leading stories, with the latest breaking news as it happens.(n)

programme.title: Two Tribes
programme.desc: Richard Osman presents a quickfire quiz in which the seven contestants are split into teams according to what they have in common with one another, based on their responses to questions about themselves. There follows a series of general knowledge rounds in which one contestant is eliminated each time, ending with two players going head to head for a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: The Pirates! In an Adventure with Scientists
programme.desc: The bungling leader of a band of inept buccaneers is determined to prove his worth to his rivals and win the coveted Pirate of the Year award. An encounter with the naturalist Charles Darwin gives him the chance to pull off a daring crime - if he can survive coming face to face with the pirate-hating Queen Victoria. Animated comedy, with the voices of Hugh Grant, Martin Freeman, Imelda Staunton and David Tennant.(n)

programme.title: The Hairy Bikers' Pubs That Built Britain
programme.desc: Dave takes Si on a pub tour of the Lake District, following in the footsteps of the poets Wordsworth and Coleridge. They sample negus, a wine-based drink from the late 1800s, and take part in a traditional pub competition to find out who is `The Biggest Liar'.(n)

programme.title: Coast Australia
programme.desc: Historian and archaeologist Neil Oliver leading a local team of presenters to explore Australia's spectacular coastline, its people, their history, and the many natural wonders. The first episode focuses on the Kimberley region of Western Australia, with Tim Flannery walking in primeval tracks along the `Dinosaur Coast'. Neil finding out about the delicate science of pearl cultivation and Xanthe Mallett visiting a unique maritime war grave. Brendan Moar learns the art of indigenous raft-making and Emma Johnston investigates the lush, protected habitat of migratory shorebirds.(n)

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: David Attenborough narrates the documentary exploring Earth's natural history and the factors that have affected it. The first edition examines how the sun affects life on Earth through the seasons, following a polar bear preparing its cubs for a long journey to avoid becoming stranded on floating glaciers. Narrated by David Attenborough.(n)

programme.title: Put Your Money Where Your Mouth Is
programme.sub-title: Eric Knowles v Danny Sebastian: UK Antiques Fair.
programme.desc: Eric Knowles takes on Danny Sebastian at an antiques fair in Nottinghamshire, with the two taking very different approaches to buying and selling.(n)

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows including Mastermind and Who Wants to Be a Millionaire? work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: Royal Recipes
programme.desc: Food inspired by royal consorts, including a favourite dish of Princess Diana, a chocolate souffle said to be enjoyed by Prince Philip and a first course named after Prince Albert.(n)

programme.title: Royal Cousins at War
programme.desc: Part two of two. The documentary examines the key role played by royalty in smoothing the path to the Anglo-Russian entente of 1907, and the part played by the Kaiser's erratic, unstable personality in the growing isolation of Germany in the years leading up to 1914. The film also explores the roles played by the German, British and Russian monarchs in the months leading up to the outbreak of the First World War and tells the story of George V's refusal to grant his cousin Nicholas II asylum in England following the Russian Revolution of 1917.(n)

programme.title: University Challenge
programme.desc: In the fifth of the academic quiz's first-round matches, four students from the University of York pit their wits against a team from the University of Warwick in a bid to reach the second stage of the competition. Jeremy Paxman asks the questions.(n)

programme.title: Nadiya's British Food Adventure
programme.desc: Nadiya Hussain takes a culinary road trip through Scotland, joining professional forager Gary Goldie at Airds Bay in Argyll and Bute to pick hogweed and sea arrowgrass to use as flavourings for a wild curry. She then heads to the Cairngorms National Park to visits the Blair Atholl watermill run by baker Rami Cohen, grinding her own flour to bake Indian five-spice soda bread, served with a red lentil dish. Back in her kitchen, Nadiya creates a vegetarian haggis tarte Tatin.(n)

programme.title: Dangerous Borders: A Journey Across India & Pakistan
programme.desc: Adnan Sarwar and Babita Sharma's second leg of their epic journey along the volatile border that divides India and Pakistan takes them through the Punjab provinces of both nations. Adnan begins at the Quaid-E-Azam Solar Park, an energy farm covering 6,500 acres and part of a £35 billion investment programme in Pakistan by the Chinese, whose government India has a fractious relationship. Babita visits the city of Chandigarh, where graffiti artist Sarwan shares his bleak view of the continuing animosity between the two countries.(n)

programme.title: Normal for Norfolk
programme.desc: Christmas is approaching at Wiveton Hall and Desmond MacCarthy is in a sociable mood, hosting a pheasant shoot for his old friends. The hall and cottages are decorated with Christmas trees and Desmond organises an end of the year party for his staff, where cockerel korma vol-au-vents are on the menu.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Kirsty Wark.(n)

programme.title: Astronauts: Do You Have What It Takes
programme.desc: New series. A group of 12 people compete against each other through six weeks of astronaut training, with the winner receiving support in pursuing a career with a space agency. Former astronaut Chris Hadfield, medical researcher Dr Kevin Fong and psychologist Dr Iya Whiteley oversee the challenges, and can eliminate contenders from the show at any time. In the first episode, they must learn to hover a helicopter.(n)

programme.title: Billy Connolly: Portrait of a Lifetime
programme.desc: A programme celebrating Billy Connolly's 75th birthday and 50 years in the business, as three Scottish artists, John Byrne, Jack Vettriano and Rachel Maclean, each create a new portrait of the comedian and actor. As he sits with each artist, Billy talks about his remarkable career which has taken him from musician and stand-up to Hollywood star and national treasure.(n)

programme.title: Going Back, Giving Back
programme.desc: Aled Jones returns with the programme in which people use their own experiences to help others, beginning with one of the original Calendar Girls meeting a young widow.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: The World's Most Photographed
programme.desc: An exploration of how John F Kennedy exploited the power of the photograph more than any other politician before him, but concealed two secrets that could potentially have brought down the Presidency. While he seemed to be exposing his whole life to the camera, the patriot with a glittering war record managed to keep his fragile state of health and his reputation for womanising hidden from the public.(n)

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: There is a twist in the tale as the detectives search for relatives of a south London woman, while another case uncovers the story of a man who led a double life.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Natasha Raskin oversees proceedings from Topsham in Devon, where experts Danny Sebastian and Gary Pe provide assistance to two teams looking for items to sell at auction.(n)

programme.title: The Farmers' Country Showdown
programme.desc: Sheepdog trainers and farmers Shirley from Lancashire and John from Yorkshire compete alongside man's best friend in the Nidderdale Agricultural Show's Sheepdog Trials.(n)

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The entrants representing Wales prepare starters, with returning chef Phil Carmichael taking on newcomers Paul Croasdale and Nick Brodie. The three chefs all create complex dishes, with both Paul and Phil championing the tomato, while Nick hopes his rabbit and carrot dish will give him the edge over the other two.(n)

programme.title: Victoria Derbyshire
programme.desc: Daily news and current-affairs programme offering discussion of breaking stories, exclusive interviews and audience interaction via social media.(n)

programme.title: BBC Newsroom Live
programme.desc: A chance to stay up to date on the day's leading stories, with the latest breaking news as it happens.(n)

programme.title: The Super League Show
programme.desc: Tanya Arnold introduces action from the latest matches in the Super League Super 8s and Qualifiers, including Castleford Tigers v Wakefield Trinity, and Leeds Rhinos v St Helens.(n)

programme.title: The Odd Life of Timothy Green
programme.desc: A couple bury a box containing their wishes for the perfect child they are unable to have. Soon afterwards, a mysterious boy with leaves growing from his feet shows up on their doorstep, claiming to be their son. The strange youngster soon transforms the lives of not only his parents, but their whole community. Fantasy, starring Jennifer Garner and Joel Edgerton.(n)

programme.title: Coast Australia
programme.desc: The team explores Sydney, with Neil Oliver discovering how close the city came to being captured in the Second World War. Xanthe Mallett learns about ingenious colonial DIY techniques for making building-mortar out of oyster shells, and Tim Flannery reveals the geological secrets of the vast and sprawling harbour. Brendan Moar examines the Sydney Harbour Bridge, while Emma Johnston hunts for tropical fish in the temperate and diverse water.(n)

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: The nature series looks at the animals that live on some of the world's highest mountains. Cameras show gelada baboons screaming to frighten off predators in Ethiopia, demoiselle cranes struggling to migrate over the Himalayas, snow leopards hunting on the peaks of Pakistan and a wild giant panda nursing a baby in a hillside cave. Presented by David Attenborough.(n)

programme.title: Put Your Money Where Your Mouth Is
programme.desc: Danny Sebastian takes on Eric Knowles at a car boot sale in Essex, where questionable bric-a-brac and bad weather are the order of the day.(n)

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows including Mastermind and Who Wants to Be a Millionaire? work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: Royal Recipes
programme.desc: Michael Buerk and Paul Ainsworth look at food created for traditional afternoon tea, starting with a twist on a royal favourite of battenburg, before trying a recipe for bath buns.(n)

programme.title: Celebrity Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Pop stars Jimmy Osmond and Tony Christie embark on the cross-country treasure-hunting challenge, joined by experts Catherine Southon and Margie Cooper. The pair hunt for bargains in the Leicestershire town of Loughborough before they head to auction in the Staffordshire city of Stoke-on-Trent.(n)

programme.title: The Big Family Cooking Showdown
programme.desc: As Zoe Ball and Nadiya Hussain's culinary competition continues, the Karim family from west London go up against the Dawes from Hampshire. Aunt Zakila is queen of the kitchen in the Karim's household, but will her spice mix leave the judges wanting more when they visit the family at home? Ellie Dawes and her scientist boyfriend Sam share a passion for food, but it remains to be seen whether their bold use of ingredients will be a step too far for the judges.(n)

programme.title: India's Partition: The Forgotten Story
programme.desc: Film director Gurinder Chadha explores the events surrounding the Partition of India in 1947, which saw the creation of the independent nations of India and Pakistan and led to violence, disruption and death. Gurinder crosses India, meeting people whose lives were torn apart by the division and talking to historians to find out the motivations behind the split.(n)

programme.title: Quacks
programme.desc: Caroline lands an invitation to meet her hero, Charles Dickens, and William finds himself in an awkward position when he exaggerates how much of a fan he is. Meanwhile, John takes an orphan under his wing, and Robert crosses paths with an uppity young volunteer called Florence Nightingale.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Kirsty Wark.(n)

programme.title: The Mash Report
programme.desc: Comedian Nish Kumar presents the satirical and surreal take on the week's news, with a team of correspondents keeping viewers up to date with everything that has happened - or not happened - this week.(n)

programme.title: Dangerous Borders: A Journey Across India & Pakistan
programme.desc: Adnan Sarwar and Babita Sharma's second leg of their epic journey along the volatile border that divides India and Pakistan takes them through the Punjab provinces of both nations. Adnan begins at the Quaid-E-Azam Solar Park, an energy farm covering 6,500 acres and part of a £35 billion investment programme in Pakistan by the Chinese, whose government India has a fractious relationship. Babita visits the city of Chandigarh, where graffiti artist Sarwan shares his bleak view of the continuing animosity between the two countries.(n)

programme.title: World News Today
programme.desc: The day's leading stories.(n)

programme.title: The Taff: The River That Made Wales
programme.desc: Writer and fisherman Will Millard goes wild swimming with a group of eccentrics trying to change the image of the often forgotten waterway. He meets retired Somali sailors drawn to Cardiff in the city's glory days as a thriving port and tells the story of how the industrial docks have been transformed. Finally, he sets out to catch migratory salmon returning to the place where they were born. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Timeshift
programme.sub-title: The Trains That Time Forgot: Britain's Lost Railway Journeys.
programme.desc: Andrew Martin investigates why named trains, once the pride of the railway companies that ran them, have now largely been confined to locomotive history. Embarking on a series of rail journeys around Britain, Andrew revisits the routes travelled by the Flying Scotsman, the Cornish Riviera Express and the Brighton Belle, three of Britain's most famous named trains, as he reflects on the bygone golden age of railways.(n)

programme.title: Vikings
programme.desc: Neil Oliver tells the story of how the age of the Vikings came to an end, using archaeological evidence to explore the lives of the first Danish kings, the spread of Christianity in Scandinavia, and the voyages of discovery undertaken by Norse sailors in the Atlantic. He also profiles Canute, the former king of England, and reveals why the reputation he has accrued over the past millennium does a disservice to his diplomatic feats. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Storyville
programme.sub-title: Silk Road - Drugs, Death and the Dark Web: Storyville.
programme.desc: Documentary about the hunt for the people behind an online black market known as the Silk Road, which was used as the platform for a multimillion-dollar digital narcotics cartel, which promised users complete anonymity and total freedom from government regulation or scrutiny.(n)

programme.title: Hidden Histories: WWI's Forgotten Photographs
programme.desc: The story of soldiers' photography during the First World War. Some British and German troops marched into battle with secret vest pocket cameras in the hope of recording what they believed would be a great adventure, however few were prepared for the horrors they would witness. The photos, many of which have never been seen in public before, provide an account of their lives in the trenches and their rapid loss of innocence, and the programme follows their relatives as they search for the secrets hidden in their ancestors' images.(n)

programme.title: Timeshift
programme.sub-title: The Trains That Time Forgot: Britain's Lost Railway Journeys.
programme.desc: Andrew Martin investigates why named trains, once the pride of the railway companies that ran them, have now largely been confined to locomotive history. Embarking on a series of rail journeys around Britain, Andrew revisits the routes travelled by the Flying Scotsman, the Cornish Riviera Express and the Brighton Belle, three of Britain's most famous named trains, as he reflects on the bygone golden age of railways.(n)

programme.title: Vikings
programme.desc: Neil Oliver tells the story of how the age of the Vikings came to an end, using archaeological evidence to explore the lives of the first Danish kings, the spread of Christianity in Scandinavia, and the voyages of discovery undertaken by Norse sailors in the Atlantic. He also profiles Canute, the former king of England, and reveals why the reputation he has accrued over the past millennium does a disservice to his diplomatic feats. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Rosslyn Chapel: A Treasure in Stone
programme.desc: Art historian Helen Rosslyn examines the art and architecture of one of the most famous medieval chapels in the world. Helen, whose husband's ancestor built the chapel more than 500 years ago, explores why it has enchanted visitors as diverse as JMW Turner, Robert Burns and Tom Hanks. Plus, she travels to Normandy in search of the stonemasons who helped to create the masterpiece.(n)

programme.title: World News Today
programme.desc: The day's leading stories.(n)

programme.title: World War One at Home
programme.sub-title: World War One at Home: Cadburys at War.
programme.desc: Documentary focusing on life away from the battlefields, being shown as part of the World War One at Home season. Richie Woodhall tells the story of brothers Laurence and Egbert Cadbury, sons of chocolate company boss George. They both saw action in the First World War - yet only one of them was a fighter.(n)

programme.title: Thailand: Earth's Tropical Paradise
programme.desc: The mountains and forests of Northern Thailand, an area that is home to a variety of wildlife, leading to unusual partnerships developing between animals and people. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Utopia: In Search of the Dream
programme.desc: Professor Richard Clay asks whether utopia is a state of mind that can therefore be found within. He explores the many means people have created to immerse themselves in a perfect moment, of epiphany or transcendence, pushing the boundaries of artistic expression and pleasure. Seeking answers in a broad range of arts, the art historian tries to compose a haiku and uncovers traces of the hedonistic medieval carnival tradition in the churches and pubs of Lancashire. He also compares and contrasts different musical escapes, interviewing Acid House legend A Guy Called Gerald (aka Gerald Simpson) and the celebrated minimalist composer Steve Reich. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Inspector Montalbano
programme.desc: New series. The Italian detective drama, based on novels by Andrea Camilleri, returns. Salvo's quiet retreat with Livia comes to an unexpected end when he is called back to Vigata to investigate the murder of an elderly prostitute, who has been strangled by an unknown assailant. Starring Luca Zingaretti.(n)

programme.title: The Brain with David Eagleman
programme.desc: Neuroscientist David Eagleman continues his exploration of the inner workings of the brain, revealing how although people may feel in conscious control of their lives, in fact almost every action they take is driven by parts of the unconscious mind.(n)
