programme.title: Will & Grace
programme.desc: The friends visit Will's mother for Christmas and spend most of their time debating whether her 10-year-old grandson is gay. Meanwhile, Grace has an encounter with old flame Sam and tries to comfort him over his recent divorce.(n)

programme.title: Will & Grace
programme.desc: The Sound of Music Sing-Along comes to town and Grace insists she and Will dress up in character costumes for the occasion. However, he arrives at the wrong venue, and Karen finds herself in trouble with the theatre's manager - forcing her and Jack to plan their escape. Taye Diggs guest stars.(n)

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Ray's close encounter with Debra's new can opener leads to a colossal argument between the couple - in which Marie, Frank and Robert cannot help getting involved. American comedy, starring Ray Romano, Patricia Heaton and Peter Boyle.(n)

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Frank shows an uncharacteristic interest in Ray's work, but proves to have an ulterior motive. Comedy, starring Ray Romano and Peter Boyle.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: To mark KACL's 50th anniversary, Frasier decides to recreate the station's first mystery theatre broadcast, but his over-directing of the actors turns the live show into a complete disaster - just as Niles predicted. Comedy, starring Kelsey Grammer.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.sub-title: Three Dates and a Break-Up - Part One.
programme.desc: Part one of two. Martin and Sherry consider ending their relationship, while Frasier scores a notable success on the romantic front, dating three women in one weekend. Comedy, starring Kelsey Grammer, John Mahoney and Marsha Mason.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.sub-title: Three Dates and a Break-Up - Part Two.
programme.desc: Part two of two. The Crane brothers congratulate themselves on getting rid of Sherry - but like the proverbial bad penny, she soon turns up again, determined not to let Martin go without a fight. Kelsey Grammer stars.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Raj is asked to create a message on the off-chance a Nasa mission discovers alien life, and the guys fight over what he should do. Meanwhile, Penny contemplates returning to acting. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons, Kaley Cuoco and Kunal Nayyar.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Howard questions his engineering abilities when he and Sheldon can't get a toy drone to fly. A cancelled flight almost stops Leonard from giving the commencement address at his former high school, while Raj pits his parents against each other when his father cuts him off financially.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Grampa is press-ganged into babysitting Bart, Lisa and Maggie while Marge and Homer visit a rural retreat in a bid to save their ailing marriage.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer and Bart set off on an epic journey to deliver a dead lorry driver's cargo, leaving Marge and Lisa at home - where aimlessness and boredom soon prompt them to embark on an adventure of their own.(n)

programme.title: Channel 4 News Summary
programme.desc: Includes news headlines, sport and weather.(n)

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Couples compete in Bognor Regis, West Sussex, with Carl and Brianha kicking off proceedings with an evening inspired by the glitz and glamour of the French Riviera. Day two sees down-to-earth couple Mark and Lisa cook up some collapsing fish cakes and a Thai curry that proves too hot for some. Finally it's Justin and Karen's turn with a fine dining menu that the pair are convinced will deliver them the £1,000 prize.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawn
programme.desc: The arrival of a life-sized suit of armour and matching horse amuses staff at the new Hatton Garden shop, while MD James takes a trip down a canal on a barge that a businessman is looking to secure a loan against. A sunseeker hopes to sell some precious family jewellery to help fund a move to Spain, and Lawrence is faced with a mysterious wooden chest thought to have belonged to the royal family.(n)

programme.title: Countdown
programme.desc: Nick Hewer and Rachel Riley present the long-running words-and-numbers game, with former boxer Barry McGuigan joining Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner.(n)

programme.title: Cheap Cheap Cheap
programme.desc: One couple risk going solo, Keith tries out a new delivery vehicle and there is confusion between some nuns and Olly Murs. Comedy game show, hosted by Noel Edmonds.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.sub-title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun.
programme.desc: Scarlette Douglas shows five properties to Paul and Maggie Meigh from Northamptonshire, who are selling their house in the UK to move to the Portuguese island of Madeira.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Nursery owner Louise hosts the first of week of dinner parties from Hastings and Rye in East Sussex, but a power cut threatens to scupper her night before it has even started.(n)

programme.title: Streetmate
programme.desc: New series. Scarlett Moffatt hosts a revival of the dating show, taking to the streets of Britain to unite single people. A personal trainer is on the hunt for a partner in Leeds.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer, Marge and the kids hitch a ride on a train, where they are entertained by a tramp who tells them a series of colourful yarns based on American folklore - all of which feature characters suspiciously reminiscent of Homer.(n)

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Darren plans to take Shane down, Mandy panics over a letter from social services and Brody sabotages Scott's plans. Meanwhile, Sienna tricks Warren into letting Kim move in to look after her.(n)

programme.title: Channel 4 News
programme.desc: Including sport and weather.(n)

programme.title: Jamie's Quick & Easy Food
programme.desc: New series. Jamie Oliver offers viewers the ultimate set of go-to recipes for quick and easy-to-remember cooking having developed a collection of tasty dishes that each use just five ingredients, producing stress-free meals perfect for busy days and for those people who don't have the time or energy to devote to complicated cooking. On the menu in the first edition are seared scallops with black pudding, mashed potatoes and peas, as well as egg and mango chutney flatbreads, rib-eye steak, and an almond pastry puff.(n)

programme.title: Superfoods: The Real Story
programme.desc: New series. Kate Quilton returns with the programme that investigates the purported health benefits of superfoods, meeting leading scientists, nutritionists and dieticians to learn which are worth the money. In the first edition, she travels to India to find out if a daily grind of pepper could be one of the most significant medical breakthroughs of the century. She also meets a scientist who believes white wine could be the key to kidney health and visits Norway to find out if sauerkraut could be a gut-health superstar.(n)

programme.title: The State
programme.desc: Jalal and Ziyaad experience bloody frontline battle when their unit is hit by a drone strike, while Shakira witnesses the horrifying aftermath of a barrel bomb and Ushna is shocked at the brutal treatment of women. Shakira must persuade a dangerous commander to set aside Isis rules and allow her to work in hospital and Jalal has a conversation that makes him question the whole rationale for his journey to Syria. Continues tomorrow.(n)

programme.title: How to Get a Council House
programme.desc: Portsmouth council officers are faced with the task of deciding whose health problems mean they are in genuine need of housing and who is not entitled to help. They deal with a couple whose six-year-old daughter has a serious kidney condition, a single father who suspects his 12-year-old has ADHD, and a terminally ill man sleeping on a sofa in his son's house, but it can be a challenge for the council to find appropriate homes for people with medical problems.(n)

programme.title: Naked Attraction
programme.desc: Anna Richardson presents the dating show in which two singletons choose their favourite from a line-up of potential dates who reveal themselves one body part at a time until fully nude. First up is 28-year-old Judy, from Glasgow, whose direct approach to love has been scaring off the boys. She's hoping that anyone brave enough to bare it all on TV, can also handle her big personality. Next up is 29-year-old Craig, from Oxfordshire. After a string of failed relationships and with his 30th birthday looming, he wants to find his perfect woman to settle down with and start a family. Will he meet his ideal match in the buff?.(n)

programme.title: Random Acts
programme.desc: New series. Zawe Ashton presents the return of the showcase for short creative films, beginning with balloon art battles on the Yorkshire Moors and pole dancing reinvented.(n)

programme.title: 60 Days in Jail
programme.desc: Sheri, Ryan and Quintin find themselves going deeper undercover, Dion and Ashleigh grapple with their respective pasts, and Monalisa has a major revelation about her daughter.(n)

programme.title: How to Make Your Marriage Work
programme.desc: The London borough of Brent boasts one of the highest marriage rates and lowest number of divorces in the country. This one-off documentary visits five Brent couples who have tied the knot to find out what keeps them together. Ranging from seven to 47 years of marriage, they discuss everything from the importance of sex in a relationship, the ups and downs of having children and whether they have ever been tempted to stray.(n)

programme.title: Little British Isles with Alison Steadman
programme.desc: Alison travels across the English Channel to discover more about the idyllic life found on the Channel Islands. In Jersey, she dives into their cultural traditions and helps inseminate the iconic Jersey cow, and finds out more about how this island continues to hold onto its own traditional values. On Alderney, Alison discovers more about the abundance of wildlife found on the island, and then travels to the tiny island of Sark in search of the ancient traditions many of the locals still fiercely protect.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer help two couples search for their ideal properties. New parents Rob and Hilary are searching for a family home in Hitchin, Hertfordshire, but finding one on their budget of £250,000 has been a struggle. Rupreet and Sundeep should be able to locate a house that will suit them with £380,000 to spend - but not without abandoning their postcode snobbery and obsession with Pinner, an expensive part of Harrow, north London.(n)

programme.title: Selling Houses with Amanda Lamb
programme.desc: The eponymous property guru heads for Southampton, where three rival sellers attempt to win an offer from young couple Alex and Ben. But before they see the houses, the sellers need to make improvements. They get £1000 a week to do the work, plus design ideas from Amanda. At Kathryn and Adrian's Victorian house, they need to add features to their drab dining room and basic kitchen. Maria needs to tone down her pink palace and make better use of her cluttered conservatory. And divorcee Mark needs to clear out and de-teenage his kids' bedrooms.(n)

programme.title: Double Your House for Half the Money
programme.sub-title: Sarah Beeny's Double Your House for Half the Money.
programme.desc: In Altrincham, Greater Manchester, writer Marnie and husband Christian both dreamed of owning an art deco house, but could only afford a small, run-down 1950s wreck, which Marnie believes is giving her health problems. Can Sarah Beeny help with their plan to extend and modernise? In Knebworth, Hertfordshire, Suzanne and Av need to enlarge their two-up, two-down, but problems arise from day one of the build, threatening the budget.(n)

programme.title: Countdown
programme.desc: Nick Hewer and Rachel Riley present the long-running words-and-numbers game, with former boxer Barry McGuigan joining Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner.(n)

programme.title: Will & Grace
programme.desc: In an episode that was originally broadcast live, Karen has a lavish birthday party with some of New York's most prestigious figures, but spends most of the celebration stuck in the bathroom with Grace, Will and Jack. American comedy, guest starring Matt Lauer.(n)

programme.title: Will & Grace
programme.desc: Will's former boss Margot offers Grace an interior design job, but she realises it clashes with her plans to redecorate a nursing home, and turns to her friend for advice. Meanwhile, Jack uncovers the truth behind Karen's secret room. Lily Tomlin guest stars.(n)

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Debra and Ray make their wills, but struggle to pick guardians for the children. They finally manage to decide - but not everyone is happy about the arrangement. Comedy, starring Ray Romano.(n)

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Debra is upset by her hippie sister's decision to become a nun, and resolves to prove her new-found faith is just a phase. Comedy, starring Patricia Heaton.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Daphne falls out with Sherry and flees the apartment after the two have a blazing row. With nowhere else to go, she asks if she can spend the night at Niles's flat, leaving him quaking with excitement. Comedy, starring David Hyde Pierce and Jane Leeves.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Niles receives divorce papers from Maris - and to show he is not as spineless as people think, he signs them immediately. Later, though, he begins to regret his impulsiveness. Comedy, starring Kelsey Grammer and David Hyde Pierce.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: After Niles asks him whether he should stay with Maris, Frasier wanders the streets in film-noir fashion to find an answer for his long-suffering brother. Comedy, starring Kelsey Grammer.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: There is a clash of personalities when Sheldon and Leonard's mothers finally meet, while Howard finally decides to do his fair share of the housework - but not without a little help from his friends. Guest starring Christine Baranski and Laurie Metcalf.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon presses Leonard and Penny to choose a date for their wedding, while he also has to deal with dramatic changes in his own relationship with Amy. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Lisa tries to make amends for cheating in an exam, but the school authorities have a vested interest in high grades and turn a deaf ear to her confession that she bought the answers from Nelson. Meanwhile, Homer adopts a bizarre new pet - a lobster.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.sub-title: The Old Man and the C Student.
programme.desc: Lisa tries to get the Olympic Games to come to Springfield, but Bart ruins her efforts with an ill-judged stand-up routine. As punishment, he is forced to undertake community service at Grampa's retirement home, where he discovers the OAPs are desperate to feel young again.(n)

programme.title: Channel 4 News Summary
programme.desc: Includes news headlines, sport and weather.(n)

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: In West Yorkshire, Stacey and Tom kick things off with a traditional European menu, with Stacey forced to confront her fears and handle chicken livers for the first time. Robin and wife Kaz steal the night with terrible jokes and comedy false teeth, while bemused Kiwi couple Leigh and Toni wonder at some of the humour. The second day sees Leigh and Toni preparing their Italian-themed menu in the tiny galley of their barge, but the biggest worry is the rabbit main course. Finally Robin and Kaz host, confident the meaty menu they have in mind will be a winner, along with their planned conga.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawn
programme.desc: Managing director James heads to Lanzarote to tackle his biggest deal yet - the sale of a £1.5million yellow submarine. A jeweller to the stars wants to pawn her collection to expand her business, while Lawrence appraises a guitar with links to punk band the Sex Pistols owned by a former millionaire who's now living in a bedsit. A doting father-to-be decides to get rid of his pride-and-joy black Ferrari to buy a family home.(n)

programme.title: Countdown
programme.desc: Nick Hewer and Rachel Riley present the words-and-numbers game, with Dictionary Corner guest Martin Lewis assisting Susie Dent.(n)

programme.title: Cheap Cheap Cheap

programme.desc: Part one of a two-part documentary following the lives of eight young people with obsessive compulsive disorder. The programme follows a woman planning her wedding who was once unable to leave her own house, an A-Level student whose condition is affecting her studies, an aspiring doctor who suffers from anxiety, and a woman who has to carry out complex rituals to control her fears.(n)

programme.title: Celebrity Big Brother's Bit on the Side
programme.desc: Rylan Clark-Neal presents the CBB companion show, featuring gossip, chat and features from the house. Including a debate on the burning issues, celebrity guests' thoughts on the latest developments.(n)

programme.title: Wanted
programme.desc: Night Watch director Timur Bekmambetov helms his first English-language feature film with this big-screen adaptation of Mark Millar's action-packed graphic novel. Wesley Gibson (James McAvoy) is a cube-dwelling hypochondriac whose uneventful life has become a mundane blur of terminal boredom. Repeatedly humiliated by his boss and constantly cuckolded by his cheating girlfriend, weakling Wes seems to be living right down to everyone's expectations that he would never amount to anything in life. However, upon discovering that the father he never knew has been brutally murdered, the spineless, clock-punching pushover is recruited into a secret society of assassins known as the Fraternity. During the course of his training, the man who was once an office-bound wimp develops lightning-fast reflexes and superhuman dexterity courtesy of his skilled mentor Fox (Angelina Jolie). Upon completing his training, Wes is assigned the task of dealing out death to the mythological Fates, who possess the ability to alter the lifelines of mortal men. It isn't long before the nebbish nerd-turned-agile assassin is erasing the bad guys with surprising efficiency, yet as Wes begins to carry the mantle passed down to him by his father, he gradually begins to suspect that his wise tutors are not the crime-fighting enforcers they present themselves to be. Now, with everything he ever wanted in life finally within his grasp, Wes is about to find out that the only thing more difficult than ending the lives of others is summoning the courage to take control of his own(n)

programme.title: Waterworld
programme.desc: Big-budget action fantasy starring Kevin Costner about the battle for survival in a world where dry land has disappeared with the melting of the polar ice caps. An amphibious loner, 'The Mariner', tries to protect survivors on an artificial atoll made from scrap metal by taking on a gang of marauding pirates. He is also intent on discovering if there is any truth in the myth that there is still some land left above water(n)

programme.title: The Flight of the Phoenix
programme.desc: When an aircraft crash-lands in the Sahara, one of the survivors, a German designer, draws up a plan to build a glider from the wreckage. But conflicts beneath the oppressive heat make their chances of success seem slim at best(n)

programme.title: Glory Road
programme.desc: A true-life story of a basketball team who broke down barriers while racking up victories is the basis for this sports drama. Don Haskins (Josh Lucas) was a high school and college basketball star who, after six years of working with high school teams, became the head coach at Texas Western University in 1962. At that time, Texas Western's basketball program was not well respected, but Haskins was determined to change that, and in 1966 Haskins assembled what he was certain was a winning team. However, Haskins' starting lineup was comprised entirely of African-American athletes at a time when racially integrated teams were still a novelty in the South and West. Despite generating a firestorm of controversy, Haskins and his players showed they could succeed where it counted -- on the court. In post-season play Haskins and the Texas Western team found themselves competing for the NCAA championship against the University of Kentucky's all-white team, lead by legendary coach Adolph Rupp (Jon Voight). Glory Road also stars Derek Luke, Alphonso McAuley, Mehcad Brooks, Al Shearer, Damaine Radcliff, Sam Jones III, and Schin S. Kerr as members of Haskins' winning team(n)

programme.title: The Omen
programme.desc: After his wife gives birth to a stillborn child, the American ambassador to Britain switches two kids in their hospital cribs. What he doesn't know is that little Damien is the Anti-Christ. Horror(n)

programme.title: Three Kings
programme.desc: Three stars team up for this unusual look at America's role in the war against Iraq. In 1991, as the Gulf War winds to a close, three American servicemen find themselves happy to have achieved victory but wondering about the ultimate importance of what they've done (especially since Saddam Hussein is still in power). Major Archie Gates (George Clooney) is a decorated Vietnam veteran and special forces officer with two weeks to go before he retires; Sgt. Troy Barlow (Mark Wahlberg) has a new baby at home; and Chief Elgin (Ice Cube) is probably just going to end up back in Detroit. So when one of them comes across a map that seems to point out where Saddam's forces have stashed a large cache of gold they stole from Kuwait, they decide to follow the trail and take some of the war booty for themselves. However, the deeper they journey into Iraq, the more they see of the consequences of America's policies in the Middle East. Although President George Bush and the American military urged Iraqi citizens to rise up against Saddam Hussein, and pledged their support to a people's movement against the leader, Iraqis found that when they took to the streets against Saddam, the United States did not back them up, and the loss of Iraqi lives was fearsome. When Gates, Barlow and Elgin become aware of what's happening, they're torn between their desire to grab the fortune they came for and the demands of their conscience to help the people they came to liberate. Three Kings was directed by David O. Russell and marked a significant change of direction after his dark-humored relationship comedies, Spanking the Monkey and Flirting with Disaster(n)

programme.title: Sideways
programme.desc: Two men having a midlife crisis take a week long road trip through California, just as one is about to take a trip down the aisle(n)

programme.title: The Last Boy Scout

programme.title: Old School
programme.desc: Three men relive their carefree college years by killing off as many brain cells as possible in this hilarious comedy. Mitch (Luke Wilson) returns home from a less-than-pleasant business trip one evening to discover his wife, Heidi (Juliette Lewis), involved in a ménage à trois with two blindfolded strangers. Feeling less than welcome at home after this, Mitch rents a house near the campus of a nearby college; two of Mitch's old college buddies, Beanie (Vince Vaughn) and Frank (Will Ferrell). Starring Will Ferrell, Vince Vaughn, Luke Wilson & Juliette Lewis(n)

programme.title: The Divergent Series: Allegiant
programme.desc: After discovering the truth about their walled city and breaking down its oppressive faction system, Tris (Shailene Woodley) and Four (Theo James) lead a journey outside of Chicago to learn more about who has been manipulating their civilization. But once their group comes face-to-face with the society that turned their city into an enclosed experiment, secrets are uncovered that threaten the fate of humankind. Miles Teller, Ansel Elgort, Naomi Watts, and Zoë Kravitz reprise their roles in the third entry of this YA adventure series, while Jeff Daniels joins the cast. Directed by Robert Schwentke(n)

programme.desc: Explosive action thriller starring Steven Seagal as an ex-DEA agent who comes out of retirement to take on a deadly gang of Jamaican drug-dealers terrorising Chicago(n)

programme.title: Ugly
programme.desc: A smart but lonely outsider looks for love in the wrong place. A finalist in the Short Film Competition at the 2016 American Black Film Festival(n)

programme.title: The Maze Runner: The Scorch Trials
programme.desc: In the next installment of the "Maze Runner" franchise Thomas (Dylan O'Brien), Teresa (Kaya Scodelario) and the rest of the Gladers search for clues about WCKD, a powerful organization in the Scorch, a bleak landscape that is filled with dangerous obstacles. The Gladers partner with resistance fighters to take on WCKD in an attempt to discover their plans for the future in this young-adult dystopian thriller from 20th Century Fox. Directed by Wes Ball who previously directed the original film, The Maze Runner. Cast includes Thomas Brodie-Sangster, Giancarlo Esposito, Aidan Gillen, Ki Hong Lee, Barry Pepper, Lili Taylor and Patricia Clarkson(n)

programme.title: Daredevil

By night, however, he is Daredevil, the costumed vigilante stalking the dark streets of Hell's Kitchen and bringing criminals to justice. When he takes on Wilson Fisk, otherwise known as the Kingpin, has he bitten off more than he can chew?(n)

programme.title: Ouija: Origin of Evil
programme.desc: In 1967 Los Angeles, a widow making ends meet as a psychic (Elizabeth Reaser) is stunned when she obtains a Ouija board that actually enables her to talk to the dead. While it's great for her business, the board also allows a vengeful ghost to possess her nine-year-old daughter (Lulu Wilson). Directed by Mike Flanagan, this horror sequel co-stars Annalise Basso, Henry Thomas, and Doug Jones(n)

programme.title: The Mummy

Special effects dominate the screen as a team of archaeologists unleashes the spirit of The Mummy, a demonic force that could well destroy the whole of mankind. Fraser stars as hunky chancer Rick O'Connell, who winds up helping beautiful Egyptologist Evie Carnahan and her clumsy brother Jonathan on their latest dig. But when The Mummy is accidentally reawakened, the future of the entire world is placed in jeopardy(n)

programme.title: Rock Star

Jennifer Aniston, Timothy Spall, Dominic West, Jason Bonham, Timothy Olyphant, Jason Flemyng(n)

programme.title: My Cousin Vinny
programme.desc: Brilliant comedy, with Marisa Tomei winning an Oscar for Best Supporting Actress, as two innocent New Yorkers are put on trial for murder in a small town and it is up to their brash Italian American cousin to save them(n)

programme.title: Scott Pilgrim vs. the World
programme.desc: Twenty-two-year-old slacker Scott Pilgrim meets Ramona Flowers, the girl of his dreams, and learns that in order to win her heart he'll have to defeat her seven evil exes in a series of video-game-styled battles. At the same time, Scott must also deal with being in a rock band and avoiding his own ex-girlfriend, an obsessed high schooler named Knives Chau(n)

programme.title: Road to Perdition
programme.desc: When his son witnesses a gangland execution, mobster Michael Sullivan is forced to flee from his old boss. Godfather Rooney sends a hitman after him, but Sullivan wants revenge himself for the murder of his wife. 1930s gangster drama which won an Oscar for its incredible cinematography(n)

programme.title: The Martian
programme.desc: After an exploratory mission goes awry, lone astronaut Mark Watney (Matt Damon) is left for dead on the hostile surface of Mars and must use his scientific ingenuity to homestead an enclosed habitat where he can survive. Meanwhile, the astronauts he left behind realize the severity of his plight and join forces with an international coalition of scientists to launch a rescue mission in defiance of NASA protocol(n)

programme.title: Wanted
programme.desc: Night Watch director Timur Bekmambetov helms his first English-language feature film with this big-screen adaptation of Mark Millar's action-packed graphic novel. Wesley Gibson (James McAvoy) is a cube-dwelling hypochondriac whose uneventful life has become a mundane blur of terminal boredom. Repeatedly humiliated by his boss and constantly cuckolded by his cheating girlfriend, weakling Wes seems to be living right down to everyone's expectations that he would never amount to anything in life. However, upon discovering that the father he never knew has been brutally murdered, the spineless, clock-punching pushover is recruited into a secret society of assassins known as the Fraternity. During the course of his training, the man who was once an office-bound wimp develops lightning-fast reflexes and superhuman dexterity courtesy of his skilled mentor Fox (Angelina Jolie). Upon completing his training, Wes is assigned the task of dealing out death to the mythological Fates, who possess the ability to alter the lifelines of mortal men. It isn't long before the nebbish nerd-turned-agile assassin is erasing the bad guys with surprising efficiency, yet as Wes begins to carry the mantle passed down to him by his father, he gradually begins to suspect that his wise tutors are not the crime-fighting enforcers they present themselves to be. Now, with everything he ever wanted in life finally within his grasp, Wes is about to find out that the only thing more difficult than ending the lives of others is summoning the courage to take control of his own(n)

programme.title: Waterworld
programme.desc: Big-budget action fantasy starring Kevin Costner about the battle for survival in a world where dry land has disappeared with the melting of the polar ice caps. An amphibious loner, 'The Mariner', tries to protect survivors on an artificial atoll made from scrap metal by taking on a gang of marauding pirates. He is also intent on discovering if there is any truth in the myth that there is still some land left above water(n)

programme.title: The Flight of the Phoenix
programme.desc: When an aircraft crash-lands in the Sahara, one of the survivors, a German designer, draws up a plan to build a glider from the wreckage. But conflicts beneath the oppressive heat make their chances of success seem slim at best(n)

programme.title: Glory Road
programme.desc: A true-life story of a basketball team who broke down barriers while racking up victories is the basis for this sports drama. Don Haskins (Josh Lucas) was a high school and college basketball star who, after six years of working with high school teams, became the head coach at Texas Western University in 1962. At that time, Texas Western's basketball program was not well respected, but Haskins was determined to change that, and in 1966 Haskins assembled what he was certain was a winning team. However, Haskins' starting lineup was comprised entirely of African-American athletes at a time when racially integrated teams were still a novelty in the South and West. Despite generating a firestorm of controversy, Haskins and his players showed they could succeed where it counted -- on the court. In post-season play Haskins and the Texas Western team found themselves competing for the NCAA championship against the University of Kentucky's all-white team, lead by legendary coach Adolph Rupp (Jon Voight). Glory Road also stars Derek Luke, Alphonso McAuley, Mehcad Brooks, Al Shearer, Damaine Radcliff, Sam Jones III, and Schin S. Kerr as members of Haskins' winning team(n)

programme.title: The Omen
programme.desc: After his wife gives birth to a stillborn child, the American ambassador to Britain switches two kids in their hospital cribs. What he doesn't know is that little Damien is the Anti-Christ. Horror(n)

programme.title: Three Kings
programme.desc: Three stars team up for this unusual look at America's role in the war against Iraq. In 1991, as the Gulf War winds to a close, three American servicemen find themselves happy to have achieved victory but wondering about the ultimate importance of what they've done (especially since Saddam Hussein is still in power). Major Archie Gates (George Clooney) is a decorated Vietnam veteran and special forces officer with two weeks to go before he retires; Sgt. Troy Barlow (Mark Wahlberg) has a new baby at home; and Chief Elgin (Ice Cube) is probably just going to end up back in Detroit. So when one of them comes across a map that seems to point out where Saddam's forces have stashed a large cache of gold they stole from Kuwait, they decide to follow the trail and take some of the war booty for themselves. However, the deeper they journey into Iraq, the more they see of the consequences of America's policies in the Middle East. Although President George Bush and the American military urged Iraqi citizens to rise up against Saddam Hussein, and pledged their support to a people's movement against the leader, Iraqis found that when they took to the streets against Saddam, the United States did not back them up, and the loss of Iraqi lives was fearsome. When Gates, Barlow and Elgin become aware of what's happening, they're torn between their desire to grab the fortune they came for and the demands of their conscience to help the people they came to liberate. Three Kings was directed by David O. Russell and marked a significant change of direction after his dark-humored relationship comedies, Spanking the Monkey and Flirting with Disaster(n)

programme.title: Sideways

programme.title: Home Shopping
programme.desc: A chance to purchase goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: Great Barrier Reef
programme.desc: An exploration of Australia's underwater ecosystem, one of the natural wonders of the world and the largest living structure on the planet. In the first of three programmes, marine biologist Monty Halls examines the complex form of the coral reef itself and the wildlife that lives on it, from deadly fish-hunting snails and sharks that can walk on land to fighting corals and parrotfish, which cocoon themselves every night.(n)

programme.title: Life on Earth: A New Prehistory
programme.desc: The natural history series' focuses on another fossil found in China, this time allowing researchers to trace the evolution of mammals back another 35 million years.(n)

programme.title: Deadly 60
programme.desc: Steve Backshall encounters an unusual fish in the waters of British Columbia, meets a giant Pacific octopus, and gets a surprise while kayaking among killer whales.(n)

programme.title: Deadly 60
programme.desc: Steve Backshall explores the wildlife of British Columbia, Canada. A search for a particularly large sea lion results in an unexpected encounter with a killer whale, and the naturalist tries his hand at becoming a raccoon in Vancouver.(n)

programme.title: The Hunt
programme.desc: Examining animals on the hunt in deserts and grasslands, where prey has nowhere to hide - but neither do predators, making the element of surprise difficult to come by. Cheetahs use their unmatched speed to solve this problem, while lions have learned to use desert storms to conceal their approach and caracals are able to blend into the tall dry grass. The programme also features footage of bald eagles stalking snow geese, hot rod ants who rely on the sun to kill their food, and headlight beetles that lure termites to their death with an eerie glow.(n)

programme.title: Great Barrier Reef
programme.desc: An exploration of Australia's underwater ecosystem, one of the natural wonders of the world and the largest living structure on the planet. In the first of three programmes, marine biologist Monty Halls examines the complex form of the coral reef itself and the wildlife that lives on it, from deadly fish-hunting snails and sharks that can walk on land to fighting corals and parrotfish, which cocoon themselves every night.(n)

programme.title: Shark
programme.desc: Wildlife documentary venturing below the waves to examine the ocean predators' behaviour. The first film reveals their many different hunting methods, from blacktip sharks gathering in huge packs and herding fish into baitballs, to tasselled wobbegongs, which ambush their prey. Other highlights include Greenland sharks, which live under the arctic ice, whitetip reef sharks - arguably the masters of night-time hunting - and the great white, shown stalking fur seals off the coast of South Africa.(n)

programme.title: Wild Ones
programme.desc: Examining the behaviour of some of the world's most intelligent creatures.(n)

programme.title: Home Shopping

programme.title: Great Barrier Reef
programme.desc: Monty Halls explores the extraordinary ecosystem that covers an area larger than Great Britain, revealing that only seven per cent of it is coral reef. The rest is a variety of interconnected habitats, including hundreds of islands, mangrove swamps, deep-water gardens, vast sand flats, meadows of sea grass and what is said to be the world's oldest jungle. All are interconnected by a giant deep-water lagoon - and all are full of amazing wildlife.(n)

programme.title: Space Voyages
programme.desc: Documentary examining the history and possible future of space exploration, beginning with the story of how both humans and robots laid the foundations for missions to the moon and beyond. It focuses on the Mars Curiosity Rover, which would never have been realised without the accomplishments of early Nasa astronauts and engineers.(n)

programme.title: Deadly 60
programme.desc: Steve Backshall and the team travel to Costa Rica on a mission to find the jaguar, the largest cat in South America. They also encounter other wildlife in the rainforest, including deadly snakes and squealing frogs.(n)

programme.title: Deadly 60
programme.desc: Steve Backshall explores the jungles of Costa Rica, where he has an encounter with a giant boa, witnesses the strike speed of a viper and examines a poisonous frog.(n)

programme.title: The Hunt
programme.desc: A look at how predators hunt on the coast, both in the water and on land. The environment is in a constant state of change as the tides ebb and flow, so any opportunities to feed must be taken quickly. The programme features footage of dolphins, octopuses, monkeys, fishing wolves and one of the world's largest ever gatherings of humpback whales.(n)

All are interconnected by a giant deep-water lagoon - and all are full of amazing wildlife.(n)

programme.title: Shark
programme.desc: The documentary series continues, revealing how the creatures are far more than just the hunters they are sometimes perceived as. New discoveries have revealed a hidden side to the shark's character, uncovering how their intricate social lives involve complicated courtship rituals, surprising ways of raising their young, and impressive powers of navigation. Paul McGann narrates.(n)

programme.title: Deadly 60
programme.desc: Steve Backshall and the team travel to Costa Rica on a mission to find the jaguar, the largest cat in South America. They also encounter other wildlife in the rainforest, including deadly snakes and squealing frogs.(n)

programme.title: Deadly 60
programme.desc: Steve Backshall explores the jungles of Costa Rica, where he has an encounter with a giant boa, witnesses the strike speed of a viper and examines a poisonous frog.(n)

programme.title: Space Voyages
programme.desc: Documentary examining the history and possible future of space exploration, beginning with the story of how both humans and robots laid the foundations for missions to the moon and beyond. It focuses on the Mars Curiosity Rover, which would never have been realised without the accomplishments of early Nasa astronauts and engineers.(n)

programme.title: The Hunt
programme.desc: A look at how predators hunt on the coast, both in the water and on land. The environment is in a constant state of change as the tides ebb and flow, so any opportunities to feed must be taken quickly. The programme features footage of dolphins, octopuses, monkeys, fishing wolves and one of the world's largest ever gatherings of humpback whales.(n)

programme.title: Great Barrier Reef
programme.desc: Monty Halls explores the extraordinary ecosystem that covers an area larger than Great Britain, revealing that only seven per cent of it is coral reef. The rest is a variety of interconnected habitats, including hundreds of islands, mangrove swamps, deep-water gardens, vast sand flats, meadows of sea grass and what is said to be the world's oldest jungle. All are interconnected by a giant deep-water lagoon - and all are full of amazing wildlife.(n)

programme.title: Tornado Alley
programme.desc: American people who have developed certain unconventional beliefs after encountering fearsome weather events.(n)

programme.title: Irrational Man
programme.desc: Nothing can snap a cynical philosophy professor out of a mental funk, except for a young student whose presence offers a breath of fresh air in his otherwise unfulfilling existence(n)

programme.title: Eddie Murphy: Raw
programme.desc: Eddie Murphy returns to his stand-up roots in New York's Felt Forum with his very up-front set including a wicked parody of Bill Cosby moralising about Murphy's searing humour, the sexual revenge women can take anytime, the difference between a Big Mac and a Homeburger and Eddie's very own fantasy marriages. Proof that Murphy isn't just a big name movie star(n)

programme.title: Made of Honor
programme.desc: A handsome and successful bachelor is taken aback when his dream girl asks him to be the "maid" of honor in her upcoming wedding in this romantic comedy starring Patrick Dempsey and Michelle Monaghan. Tom (Dempsey) and Hannah (Monaghan) have been best friends for years. Though all the hard times, Hannah has been the one constant in Tom's life, and the one person he knows he can always rely on. When Hannah leaves for a six-week business trip in Scotland, Tom is surprised to realize how truly lonely he is without her. Life just isn't the same without Hannah around, so the moment she returns, Tom resolves to ask for her hand in marriage. But apparently Hannah's trip wasn't all business, because upon returning home Hannah announces that she has gotten engaged to a dashing Scotsman and will soon be starting a new life overseas. She's convinced that Tom will be thrilled for her, and wants him to play a crucial role in the wedding. His spirits crushed but his love for Hannah stronger than ever before, Tom reluctantly agrees to be the "maid" of honor so that he can prove his love in no uncertain terms and convince her to call off the wedding before true happiness slips through his fingers(n)

programme.title: Catch .44
programme.desc: Three friends take on a simple enough job: intercept a rival drug shipment for their crime boss at an isolated diner. But everyone soon realizes no one is who they seem to be and the job may be something else entirely. What started out as a simple task with clear instructions turns out to be a deadly game with big guns pointed at everyone(n)

programme.title: Patriot Games
programme.desc: Action thriller. Harrison Ford plays ex-CIA agent Jack Ryan who, on a visit to London with his family, foils the assassination of a government minister by the IRA, killing one of the attackers in the process. Swearing vengeance, IRA man Sean Miller follows Ryan and his family to their seaside home in America, where he and his followers plan to exact their revenge. Based on Tom Clancy's novel, and directed by Phillip Noyce(n)

programme.title: Ricki and the Flash
programme.desc: An aging rocker returns home to her estranged family after years on the road following her dreams, and must face the music as she tries to make things right with her loved ones(n)

programme.title: Thunderball
programme.desc: In his fourth outing as James Bond, Sean Connery comes up against the evil Emilio Largo, who is holding the world to ransom with a nuclear bomb stolen from NATO. Agent 007 promptly packs his bags and heads for the Bahamas to save the world, armed with a devastating array of gadgetry(n)

programme.title: Outlander
programme.desc: Castle Leoch. Claire is brought to Castle Leoch under suspicion as an English spy(n)

programme.title: About Last Night
programme.desc: David Mamet's play +Sexual Perversity in Chicago was adapted for the big screen by fellow Chicago citizen Tim Kazurinsky and became About Last Night... The film stars Rob Lowe as Danny and Demi Moore as Debbie. The pair meet and engage in a torrid sexual relationship, but then slowly negotiate if there is anything more between them. Lowe seeks advice from his loudmouthed friend Bernie (Chicago native James Belushi), whose offers little more than outrageous tales of his randy exploits. Debbie confides in her best friend Joan (Elizabeth Perkins), a bitter, single kindergarten teacher who has lost any hope of finding the right person on the dating scene. Although Danny and Debbie talk, they have trouble communicating. The film ends on a coda that suggests the pair are still unsure as to where their relationship may be headed(n)

programme.title: Rapid Fire
programme.desc: A young art student witnesses a drug murder and is placed in protective custody by federal agents. It's not too long before he realizes that the only real protection he can count on is his own martial-arts training(n)

programme.title: Vamps
programme.desc: New York party girls Goody and Stacey live secret lives as vampires, until their delicate balancing act is upset by love. Comedy(n)

programme.title: The Living Daylights
programme.desc: In this instalment of the James Bond series, Agent 007 is assigned to protect a Russian defector from the KGB. When the defection proves to be an elaborate ploy, Bond woos her anyway, and together they follow a trail to a crooked American arms dealer supplying weapons to Afghanistan(n)

programme.desc: John Tucker is a high school basketball star dating three different girls at the same time: the activist vegan, the over-achieving blonde journalist, and the sassy cheerleading squad captain(n)

programme.desc: Ultra-violent futuristic thriller about infantry trainees preparing to wipe out mankind's newest enemy: giant bugs from outer space(n)

programme.title: Wimbledon
programme.desc: Tennis player Peter Colt (Paul Bettany) is about to retire, unable to fulfill his dream of becoming one of the world's top players. He holds position 119 in the world ranking, but, all the same, he is invited to play in Wimbledon. The traditional tournament, where he finds himself for the first time, seems the ideal place for a farewell, to start a new life the following day as a tennis coach, though the plan might not be very appealing. At the same championship is Lizzie Bradbury (Kirsten Dunst), heading for stardom and dating the American, Jake Hammond (Austin Nichols), another great figure in the circuit. But Peter and Lizzie happen to meet one day and their destiny starts to look different from what seemed unchangeable(n)

programme.title: The Living Daylights
programme.desc: In this instalment of the James Bond series, Agent 007 is assigned to protect a Russian defector from the KGB. programme.desc: After a woman suffers a brutal rape in a bar one night, a prosecutor assists in bringing the perpetrators to justice, including the ones who encouraged and cheered on the attack(n)

programme.title: Stick
programme.desc: Burt Reynolds stars in the Elmore Leonard story of a vengeful ex-con in South Florida's drug underworld(n)

programme.title: The A-Team
programme.desc: Mexican Slayride. In the series premiere, reporter Amy Allen enlists the Team's help in locating a colleague who has disappeared in Mexico. Part 1 of two(n)

programme.title: Super Capers
programme.desc: Wonderfully wacky romp about an aspiring crimefighter (Justin Whalin) whose "[super]powers are in development" when he joins a league of hapless superheroes on a time-traveling adventure to fight the forces of evil and thwart a supervillain and his scheme to become a gold-bullion-aire. Michael Rooker, Danielle Harris, Ryan McPartlin, Doug Jones, Tom Sizemore, June Lockhart. Produced, written and directed by Ray Griggs, who costars as caped crusader "Puffer Boy."(n)

programme.title: Jaws
programme.desc: An enormous great white shark terrorises Amity, a summer resort town, and a police chief, scientist and a fisherman plan to stop it(n)

programme.title: The Great Escape
programme.desc: In this epic adventure film, based on the true story, the Nazis gather all their most devious and troublesome POWs and place them in a new prison camp, which was designed to be impervious to escapes. Immediately, the prisoners develop a scheme that includes building three separate escape tunnels(n)

programme.title: A Bridge Too Far
programme.desc: An all-star cast recreates the fateful World War II battle for Arnhem. The First Airborne Division parachutes into occupied Holland in 1944 as part of Operation Market Garden, an ambitious Allied plan to capture six Dutch bridges and cut off the Germans, but events conspire to threaten the whole operation. Based on the book by Cornelius Ryan(n)

programme.title: Solomon Kane
programme.desc: Wandering 16th-century warrior Solomon Kane renounces violence in a desperate bid to escape Satan's grasp, but he finds himself forced back into battle when a powerful evil threatens England(n)

programme.title: The Towering Inferno
programme.desc: A skyscraper and an all-star cast go up in flames in Irwin Allen's classic disaster movie. To celebrate the construction of the Glass Tower, the world's tallest building, architect Doug Roberts (Paul Newman) and builder James Duncan (William Holden) hold a gala bash on the highest floors. Trouble is, Duncan's son-in-law and electrical subcontractor Roger Simmons (Richard Chamberlain) installed faulty wiring throughout the 138-story behemoth to save money. While the guests -- including Doug's lady friend (Faye Dunaway), a rich widow (Jennifer Jones), a con man (Fred Astaire), and a politico (Robert Vaughn) -- enjoy the party, and a security guard (O.J. Simpson) wonders why his equipment is on the fritz, a burnt-out circuit breaker ignites some garbage on the 85th floor, swiftly turning the high-rise into, well, a towering inferno. With the guests trapped on the 135th floor, it's up to Roberts and Fire Chief O'Hallorhan (Steve McQueen) to find a way to stop the blaze. Though not the first all-star '70s disaster movie (1970's Airport and 1972's The Poseidon Adventure preceded it), The Towering Inferno was the most popular and the most spectacular. In a move that would become more common in late-'90s blockbuster Hollywood, The Towering Inferno's mammoth production was mounted by two studios; screenwriter Stirling Silliphant combined the two novels owned by the studios into one saga. 1970s "shake 'n bake" maestro Allen, with co-director John Guillermin (Allen did the action sequences), tapped into deep fears about the fragility of modern life in the face of extreme natural phenomena, as well as into the envies and insecurities of middle-aged professional men. The Towering Inferno packed theaters and earned eight Oscar nominations, including Best Picture; it won for Cinematography, Editing, and Song. While its heroic, no-nonsense men provided some traditional comfort, The Towering Inferno still might provoke second thoughts about going into a skyscraper(n)

programme.title: Monk
programme.desc: When Adrian's estranged truck-driver father shows up out of the blue at Christmas after a near 40-year absence, the detective decides to join him on the road - where they stumble across a very peculiar mystery. Guest starring Dan Hedaya, with Tony Shalhoub.(n)

programme.title: Monk
programme.sub-title: Mr Monk and the Three Pies.
programme.desc: Adrian's estranged brother Ambrose, an obsessive hoarder and agoraphobic, helps him investigate a typically bizarre murder involving a sack race, a bingo tournament and a cherry pie. Drama, guest starring John Turturro, with Tony Shalhoub.(n)

programme.title: Monk
programme.sub-title: Mr Monk and the TV Star.
programme.desc: An obsessed fan (Sarah Silverman) confesses to the murder of a TV star's ex-wife, but Adrian is not convinced of her guilt and sets out to ensure the culprit is brought to justice. A doctored keep-fit video provides him with the clue he needs to solve the case. Guest starring Billy Burke (The Twilight Saga).(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: Consultant Patrick Jane uses the skills honed during his former career as a fraudulent psychic to help the California Bureau of Investigation solve crimes. In his first case, he investigates a double murder. His colleagues believe the crimes were committed by notorious serial killer Red John - but Patrick's powers of observation lead him to suspect they are the handiwork of a copycat. American drama, starring Simon Baker.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: A woman is found smothered to death in a vineyard - and although suspicion initially falls on her drug-dealer boyfriend, Jane pursues a separate line of enquiry based on the colour of the victim's hair. Reasoning that her death was caused accidentally by a would-be rapist who will inevitably be driven to strike again, he persuades Wayne, Grace and Kimball to help him catch the culprit.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Tony tries to piece together the events that led to him lying wounded in a hospital bed, having been shot in the chest through his bulletproof vest. Under the guidance of therapist Dr Rachel Cranston, his memory begins to return and suspicion falls on his ex-lover EJ Barrett. Starring Mark Harmon, Michael Weatherly and Sarah Jane Morris.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The investigators examine the death of US marine Tommy Hill, who appears to have been fatally stabbed en route to a homecoming party thrown in his honour by his foster family. McGee and Ziva follow a trail of blood that leads them to a mobile phone, while Abby discovers the victim had been trying to hack into Virginia's state website and Ducky's autopsy reveals that Hill had been injected with a sedative.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: Patrick uses controversial tactics to catch the killer of a teenage girl whose body has been found on a beach, even though his unorthodox approach risks jeopardising the entire investigation. Speculating that the victim's surfer friends may be able to reveal the truth about how she died, he announces that he is going to hypnotise them in an attempt to jog their memories - but plans a cunning double bluff.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: When a wealthy businessman is found tortured to death in the safe room of his house, the agents discover he was living a double life with a mistress. The plot thickens when the victim's daughter is kidnapped, so Patrick involves the dead man's wife and girlfriend in an audacious plan to close the case. Starring Simon Baker.(n)

programme.title: Body of Proof
programme.desc: Neurosurgeon Megan Hunt gets a job as a coroner in Philadelphia after a car accident leads to her quitting the operating theatre. She and her partner investigate when the body of a female jogger is found floating in a river. Pilot episode of the crime drama, starring Dana Delany.(n)

programme.title: Body of Proof
programme.desc: A man and his former sweetheart are found shot dead in a car and while police believe the male victim killed his companion then turned a gun on himself, Megan has an alternative theory. Further investigation reveals the pair were trying to rekindle their romance, which might have inflamed a domineering ex-lover. Dana Delany stars.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: US Navy lieutenant Paul Booth is shot dead while sitting on a park bench. It turns out that the last people he called were his boss, his wife and Penelope Langston - a rebellious academic who also happens to be McGee's grandmother. She says that the victim was an old student of hers who kept in touch, but later reveals she was recruited to work on a special project during the Vietnam War by the head of a top-secret think tank Booth was a member of. Guest starring Lily Tomlin, with Mark Harmon and Sean Murray.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A man who died after being knocked down by a van is revealed to be a professional hitman responsible for at least six contract killings - and his next target was to be a navy lieutenant commander. Meanwhile, Abby is delighted at being a match for a teenager who needs a kidney transplant, but she is informed that someone else with very similar DNA has also been identified as suitable. Has she found a relative she never knew about? Guest starring Brett Tucker (Neighbours).(n)

programme.title: False Flag
programme.desc: Natalie's money-laundering operation is connected to Sean and Gabi Silver, who also seem to be linked with Asia's brother, newly arrived in Israel for a visit. In Hebrew.(n)

programme.title: Marvel's Agent Carter
programme.desc: Peggy calls upon Howling Commandos squad for backup when she is finally trusted with a mission. But when SSR Chief Dooley sends Agent Thompson with her, her cover could be at risk.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Quagmire accidentally marries a prostitute when he, Peter and Joe get drunk while visiting the Harvard University campus. Desperate to escape his new wife, he decides to pretend he is gay, and turns to one of his companions to become his emergency boyfriend.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Meg goes on a Valentine's Day date with a guy she met online. Lois and Peter spend the day lazing in bed, Brian is visited by all of his former girlfriends and Quagmire is transformed into a beautiful woman.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Fr Donovan organises a Christmas play at the shopping centre, and casts Stan as Santa Claus and Roger as Jesus - but they land themselves in trouble after getting into a fight with each other. Elsewhere, Hayley and Jeff adopt a child, who turns out to be possessed.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Steve tries to prove his toughness to Stan by adopting the persona of a superhero, while Francine also goes through an identity crisis when she receives news that could change the family for ever.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.sub-title: I Never Met the Dead Man.
programme.desc: Peter unwittingly destroys the town's TV transmitter and persuades Meg to take the blame by promising to buy her a car. Meanwhile, Stewie tries to build a weather control device in a misguided bid to rid the world of broccoli.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Meg is thrilled to make a new friend, unaware she is a member of a suicide cult. Peter inadvertently cancels Lois's plans for Stewie's first birthday party and has to go to great lengths to make alternative arrangements.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Roger becomes Steve's legal guardian, but his overzealous approach to parenting gets his adopted son's school principal fired. Meanwhile, Stan and Francine decide to make their own fun at the world's biggest water park.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Stan persuades his last single friend to get married so he can realise his dream of becoming a best man, but when he invites an ex-convict to the wedding, she jeopardises the event. Elsewhere, Ricky Martin causes Roger to doubt himself.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Peter and Lois send Chris to space camp to boost his self-esteem. When his stint ends and the Griffins arrive to pick him up, they are accidentally launched into space and it is down to the awkward youth to land the clan safely back on Earth.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Brian writes a play that becomes a hit in Quahog, but loses his confidence when he finds that Stewie is also a budding playwright and is better at it. When the toddler sees how upset his friend is, he decides to make amends. Animation, featuring the guest voice of playwright Alan Bennett as himself.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Stan creates attractive alter ego Phyllis in a desperate bid to bond with his son, but when he takes things too far, Francine is forced to intervene. Elsewhere, a group of men takes advantage of Roger's new limousine service, prompting him to set out on a manhunt to exact revenge. With the guest voices of Sarah Michelle Gellar and Patrick Stewart.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: A jealous Francine tries to break up Stan's renewed relationship with a former girlfriend, only to unwittingly leave Roger at the mercy of an alien-hunter. Elsewhere, Steve accidentally wears Hayley's panties to school, and finds they bring him luck.(n)

programme.desc: A woman is stabbed to death and her body discovered in a forest, and suspicion falls on her missing friend, who has seemingly fled the scene. programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: The severed hand of a casino owner is discovered near the Nevada-California state border, leading the CBI team to suspect a Mafia-style killing. However, Jane pursues a separate line of inquiry, one that leads him to uncover an illicit relationship between the victim's wife and the establishment's head of security.(n)

programme.title: Body of Proof
programme.desc: Megan conducts an autopsy on a woman found murdered in a motel room and is shocked to discover the victim was one of her former patients. However, she is also surprised to discover the impact she had on the dead woman's life - and begins to wonder if she should take more of an interest in the lives of those around her. Crime drama, starring Dana Delany as a former neurosurgeon working as a coroner.(n)

programme.title: Body of Proof
programme.desc: Megan tries to identify a murder victim from body parts found by a homeless man - a gruesome task made worse by Lacey's filming of her in action for a school project. Crime drama, starring Dana Delany.(n)

programme.desc: The murder of a coastguard officer on board an abandoned cargo ship draws the team's attention to a family of Lebanese refugees hoping to find a new home in America. programme.title: How I Met Your Mother
programme.desc: Karma. ­Barney can't stop thinking about Quinn and tracks her down at the strip club where she works. After she gets a lot of money out of him in tips, he realises that she is manipulating him and feels this is payback time for the way he has treated women in the past. Ted is still upset about Robin moving out and can't work out what to do with her old room, while Marshall and Lily try to convert Robin into a suburbanite when she stays with them on Long Island(n)

programme.title: How I Met Your Mother
programme.desc: The Broath. Barney tries to persuade his friends to meet Quinn and get to know her properly. However, Ted is convinced that Quinn is only after Barney's money and breaks his promise to keep her job a secret, telling everyone that she's a stripper. The gang do their utmost to divide Barney and Quinn, but end up regretting their actions. Meanwhile, Ted and Robin attempt to repair their friendship, and Marshall and Lily reveal a little too much information about their sex life(n)

programme.title: How I Met Your Mother
programme.desc: Trilogy Time. Speculations run wild as Ted, Barney and Marshall imagine what their lives will be like three years down the road(n)

programme.title: How I Met Your Mother
programme.desc: Now We're Even. Marshall is astounded when he discovers that Lily has had an erotic dream about Ranjit, and Barney's attempts to take Ted's mind off Quinn's stripping have unexpected consequences. Meanwhile, Robin single-handedly lands the news helicopter after the pilot has a stroke(n)

programme.title: How I Met Your Mother
programme.desc: Good Crazy. Despite pretending to play it cool, Barney is plagued by jealousy as a result of his girlfriend Quinn's occupation as a stripper and he tries to get her to switch careers. Ted realises that he needs to repair his damaged friendship with Robin when all of the women he meets online remind him of her. Marshall's fretful over-preparation for the baby's arrival drives Lily to distraction, so she packs him off to Atlantic City for the weekend(n)

programme.title: How I Met Your Mother
programme.desc: The Magician's Code, Part 1. programme.desc: Farhampton. programme.title: How I Met Your Mother
programme.desc: The Pre-Nup. On the advice of a colleague, Barney puts together an extensive pre-nuptial agreement that lays out the rules for behaviour within marriage, as well as the terms for divorce. programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Marge in Chains. Springfield is hit with an epidemic of the Osaka Flu, and Marge (voice of Julie Kavner) is the only member of the Simpson household who manages to avoid coming down with the bug. Unfortunately, this means she has to wait on Homer (voice of Dan Castellaneta), Bart (voice of Nancy Cartwright), Lisa (voice of Yeardley Smith), and Grampa (also voiced by Castellaneta) hand and foot while they struggle with the ailment. Overworked and preoccupied, Marge forgets to pay for a pint of whiskey Grampa asked her to pick up at the Kwik-E-Mart, and Apu (voice of Harry Shearer) decides to press charges. Marginally qualified attorney Lionel Hutz (voice of Phil Hartman) defends Marge in court, and given Hutz's level of legal acumen, it comes as little surprise when she soon finds herself behind bars. But it isn't long before the rest of Springfield discovers they're as dependent on Marge Simpson as her family. "Marge in Chains" first aired on May 6, 1993; David Crosby makes a cameo appearance as Lionel Hutz's 12-step sponsor(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homr. Homer Simpson (voice of Dan Castellaneta) takes his kids Bart (voice of Nancy Cartwright) and Lisa (voice of Yeardley Smith) to an animation festival, where he sees a demonstration of Animotion, a new process that can turn human movement into character animation on screen. Certain this is the wave of the future, Homer invests the all the family's savings in Animotion, Inc., without Marge (voice of Julie Kavner) knowing about it. Animotion quickly goes belly-up, leaving the Simpsons penniless, and Homer begins submitting to medical experiments to earn extra money. The doctors using Homer as a guinea pig make the startling discovery that he has several crayons lodged in his brain, which he shoved up his nose as a boy; removing the wax markers causes Homer's unimpressive IQ to rise to genius level. While Lisa is delighted to have another intellectual in the household at last, Homer's friends and co-workers aren't especially happy with the newer, brighter man, and it puts his job as safety monitor at Springfield's nuclear power plant in serious jeopardy. "Homr" was first aired on January 7, 2001(n)

Adventure, starring Nicholas Rowe, Alan Cox and Sophie Ward.(n)

He comes to sympathise with the natives, and helps them fight back against his employers. James Cameron's sci-fi adventure, starring Sam Worthington, Zoe Saldana, Sigourney Weaver and Stephen Lang.(n)

programme.desc: Jamie Oliver turns his attention to recipes using furred game, including rabbit - once a staple on Britain's dinner tables - fed on the best vegetables from the chef's garden. He demonstrates how to prepare his own Essex fried rabbit, along with free-range venison and a pearl barley ragu.(n)

programme.title: Jamie Does
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver steers away from the tourist trails in Venice as he explores the gastronomy of the Italian city. He prepares spaghetti vongole for a group of local fishermen, is taught the art of the perfect risotto by Ruggero Bovo, samples prosecco and cooks a bellini with beef carpaccio. The chef also tries his hand at minestrone with vegetables before being joined by old friend Gennaro Contaldo to make a Venetian tiramisu.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond makes Christmas goodies to give as gifts, including homemade gumdrops, Christmas cherries, pretzel turtles, cayenne cheese straws and sweet spicy smoky roasted almonds.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond celebrates her and her husband's anniversary by preparing a Colorado wedge salad, prime rib for five with chimichurri, and rustic country bread with honey butter.(n)

programme.title: Extreme Cake Wars
programme.desc: Four bakers compete in an epic challenge, creating Star Wars-themed cakes for a huge bash celebrating Disney's Star Wars video game.(n)

programme.title: Kids BBQ Championship
programme.desc: Three contestants enter the barbecue arena, but only one will emerge victorious, winning the title of Kids BBQ Champion.(n)

programme.title: Jamie Does
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver visits the villages surrounding Toulouse in the French Pyrenees, an area renowned for its artisan food. He goes truffle-hunting and prepares an omelette with the pickings, learns how to make bread in the traditional way, and joins locals for a wild boar hunt. The chef also shows how to prepare tarte Tatin, Roquefort salad, confit of duck and a country-style terrine.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver demonstrates the versatility of pastry as he prepares a variety of sweet and savoury recipes using pastry along with home-grown fruit and vegetables from his Essex garden. The chef shows how to create an Italian ham, nettle and spinach tart, a pie made with steak, Guinness and cheese, plus a traditional apple and blackberry pie.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver turns his attention to dishes using eggs collected from his hand-reared free-range hens. He creates a home-made tagliatelle, an omelette salad with bresaola, and a meringue with hot pears and chocolate sauce. He also starts some former battery hens off on their journey to a free-range life.(n)

programme.title: Man Fire Food
programme.desc: Roger visits Puerto Rico to try out their grilled cuisine.(n)

programme.title: Man Fire Food
programme.desc: Roger hangs out with chefs in Alexander City, Alabama, and Charleston, South Carolina, who are putting a whole new spin on rotisserie cooking in the great outdoors.(n)

programme.title: Jamie's American Road Trip
programme.desc: The crusading chef reaches the final stop on his tour, a Navajo reservation in Arizona. Here, he encounters some of the country's oldest culinary traditions, and is given a crash course in the tribe's spirituality. However, he is disappointed to see the extent to which Navajo children are becoming reliant on junk food, and sets out to help them embrace their heritage by introducing them to Native American versions of fast food.(n)

programme.title: Restaurant Stakeout
programme.desc: Willie Degel helps a man running his mother's restaurant after a massive theft.(n)

programme.title: Mystery Diners
programme.desc: A team helps restaurant owners who suspect their employees are not doing their jobs correctly.(n)

programme.title: Mystery Diners
programme.desc: A team helps restaurant owners who suspect their employees are not doing their jobs correctly.(n)

programme.title: Bizarre Foods America
programme.desc: Andrew Zimmern makes a trip to the coastal crossroads of the South in Savannah, Georgia.(n)

programme.title: Restaurant: Impossible
programme.desc: Robert Irvine helps the Padre Rita Grill in South Padre Island, where neither the food nor the music is doing well, and the chef must overhaul the decor and get the owners focused.(n)

programme.title: Mystery Diners
programme.desc: When Joe and Fran, owners of Geppino's Sicilian Kitchen, hear customer complaints about stolen items, Joe suspects their daughter's boyfriend is to blame.(n)

programme.title: Mystery Diners
programme.desc: Kristian, owner of Tavern on Main, fears someone on his staff is stealing donations from his restaurant's annual Thanksgiving Food Drive. Charles Stiles sends in Mystery Diners to see if any employees are taking instead of giving.(n)

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: Barefoot Contessa - Back to Basics
programme.desc: Ina and Jeffrey start the day with a fabulous breakfast, before heading off to Brooklyn for a culinary tour armed with a packed lunch, including a visit to a pizza place.(n)

programme.title: Barefoot Contessa - Back to Basics
programme.desc: American chef and cookbook writer Ina Garten samples a dinner of chicken with wild mushrooms and green salad, before cooking a baked goats' cheese at Sinskey's vineyard.(n)

programme.title: Barefoot Contessa - Back to Basics
programme.desc: The chef prepares a roasted shrimp with feta in exchange for an ice cream master-class from friend and creamery owner Rori Trovato.(n)

programme.title: Barefoot Contessa - Back to Basics
programme.desc: American chef and cookbook writer Ina Garten prepares tomato crostini and whipped feta. Plus, she makes thyme roasted marcona almonds as a cocktail snack.(n)

programme.title: Anna Olson: Fresh
programme.desc: Anna Olson prepares a harvest supper, beginning with a unique dish of salmon with a horseradish panko crust, served with a lemon and dill butter sauce.(n)

programme.title: Anna Olson: Fresh
programme.desc: The chef is throwing a spontaneous dinner party with French flare, and prepares an entree of turkey escalope with citrus haricots vert, and creme fraiche mashed potatoes.(n)

programme.title: The Healthy Gourmet
programme.desc: Comic Brian Coughlin may kill on stage, but his friends think his cooking is no laughing matter.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond makes meals that can be prepared in advance, including beef sandwiches and a meat sauce - the secret to so many fabulous feasts.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond turns her attention to desserts, including marshmallow pops for a sleepover treat and lime and coconut butter cookies for her step-mother.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond treats her family to a frontier-style Tex-Mex feast, featuring chicken and beef fajitas, after they spend the day working cattle.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond demonstrates how to prepare her own take on comforting home cooking, including a chicken taco for lunch and ideas for doctoring up dressing.(n)

programme.title: Extreme Cake Wars
programme.desc: Four bakers compete in an epic challenge, creating Star Wars-themed cakes for a huge bash celebrating Disney's Star Wars video game.(n)

programme.title: Patricia Heaton Parties
programme.desc: Patty's making one of her favourite cocktails, The End Zone, as well as Cleveland stuffed potatoes, sloppy Joe pockets, kickoff cupcakes and sweet and savoury popcorn.(n)

programme.title: Patricia Heaton Parties
programme.desc: Patricia picks out some favourite recipes to make for her boys, including shepherd's pie, popovers with roast beef and horseradish, strawberry trifle and a fresh fruit sangria.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver demonstrates the versatility of pastry as he prepares a variety of sweet and savoury recipes using pastry along with home-grown fruit and vegetables from his Essex garden. The chef also shows how to prepare tarte Tatin, Roquefort salad, confit of duck and a country-style terrine.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree prepares various meatless meals, including broccoli cheese baked potatoes, grilled aubergine steaks, roasted vegetable panzanella, Italian cornbread and tofu lettuce wraps.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond makes dinner for her family, preparing a menu of spicy slow cooked ribs, cheesy hominy casserole, broccoli salad and ice cream layer cake.(n)

programme.title: Extreme Cake Wars
programme.desc: Four chefs create Dr Seuss-themed cakes to celebrate the release of 'What Pet Should I Get?'.(n)

programme.title: Kids BBQ Championship
programme.desc: New series. Four of the nations finest kid barbecuers grill up their best for guest judge Shannon Ambrosio, as they tackle barbecue sandwiches and baby back ribs.(n)

programme.title: Jamie Does
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver visits the Greek capital, where he heads to the street markets for his take on the local fast food - souvlaki and kebabs. The chef then learns how honey is made, teams up with a cheese-making priest and milks a goat, and prepares a selection of recipes including fisherman's stew, Greek salad, pistachio and honey cake, and a tuna dish.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver demonstrates the versatility of rhubarb, a plant that has been neglected in the UK even though the country produces some of the best crops in the world. The chef uses it as a foundation for a hot and sour dish with crispy pork and noodles, a ginger souffle and a creamy cocktail drink.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: The chef reveals three simple ways to cook and dress asparagus, and demonstrates how best to use the vegetable in a meal. Gardener Brian also explains that once established, asparagus practically takes care of itself and can last for up to 20 years.(n)

programme.title: Man Fire Food
programme.desc: Roger Mooking is in Florida, fanning the flames for something savoury and something sweet, and he also meets a young pit-master in Crawfordville.(n)

programme.title: Man Fire Food
programme.desc: Roger meets up with two talented Southern chefs in Miami, Florida, and Birmingham, Alabama, who both own spectacular outdoor cooking rig.(n)

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieri finds a Mexican restaurant-market combo dishing out tasty tacos al pastor and carnitas tamales in Minnesota, and in Denver, he enjoys a unique dessert specialty.(n)

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieri heads to Massachusetts, where he tastes pickle chips and a scone sandwich. Plus, in Colorado, an NFL pro and Triple-D alum team have green chilli and mile-high burgers.(n)

programme.title: Still Open All Hours
programme.desc: The shopkeeping comedy returns with a festive instalment. Granville and Gastric find themselves playing marriage counsellors, while Leroy adopts a festive disguise to avoid relationship trouble of a different kind. Meanwhile, Mrs Featherstone struggles to get into the Christmas spirit and Kath attempts to bring the street together as one harmonious choir of carollers to beat Finkle Street once and for all - but does Granville have a trick up his sleeve to help them out? Starring David Jason, Tim Healy, James Baxter and Stephanie Cole.(n)

programme.title: Floyd's American Pie
