programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Luke Doonan and Jasmine Harman help a couple who are torn between returning to family roots in Northumberland or heading to the warmer climate of southern France. Phil and Liz need to find a place big enough to cater for their large family and are searching for somewhere with plenty of land.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.sub-title: Colne Estuary v Canal du Midi.
programme.desc: Laura Hamilton helps a couple with a love of barges and canals downsize to a property near a waterway so they can pursue their ideal lifestyle and hobbies. Lisa would like to relocate to the Colne Estuary in Essex, but her partner Michael is drawn to the Canal du Midi in southern France.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contest begins at the King's Head in Addlethorpe, Lincolnshire, where landlady Helen Coy and her bar manager and best friend Emma Green are pulling out all the stops to win. The B&B owners are taken back to their childhood at the funfair, At dinner, B&B beginners Louise and Andy Macbeth rattle nerves when Louise reveals her past career as a hospitality journalist - leaving pub veteran Helen less than impressed.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: B&B newcomers Andy and Louise Macbeth invite their rival hoteliers to spend the night at the dog-friendly Beck Hall in North Yorkshire, where an extra-critical Helen and Emma discover what they believe to be stray dog hairs in their bed. A fishing trip makes Terri feel a little out of sorts, and when the time arrives for feedback, the managers are surprised to learn two of their guests have indicated they would not come back for a second stay.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants travel to the Albaston in Torquay for the third day of the competition, where they are welcomed by owners and avid souvenir collectors, Kevin and Julie Shadbolt. Terri and Stuart are impressed by their room, but are startled by the memorabilia in the communal lounge, and expectations are raised at dinner when Kevin reveals he has a secret recipe for success when it comes to breakfast. However, at feedback the next day, tensions begin to rise.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final stay of the week is in Bournemouth, at Terri and Stewart's specialist dance holiday venue the Hotel Piccadilly, where a class in the grand ballroom soon has the guests in a spin. However, temperatures rise over dinner when the simmering tension between Louise and Helen finally boils over.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The owners meet up for the last time to find out what they've been paid and to settle some scores. King's Head landlady Helen challenges Louise and Andy about the problems they reported on cleanliness in the bathroom. while Louise and Andy from Beck Hall get hot under the collar when the others criticise their dog-friendly approach.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Laura Hamilton and Jasmine Harman help recently widowed Jan decide whether to spend her £100,000 budget on a house near to her sister in Kent, or a renovation project to keep her busy in Abruzzo, Italy.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: A range of properties in Bournemouth, Dorset, and Sicily provide food for thought for Paul and Chris, the owners of a B&B in northern France who are ready for a slower pace of life in a different country.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.sub-title: Queenborough, Kent: Castle in the Round.
programme.desc: The team travels to Queenborough Castle on the Isle of Sheppey, Kent, the last royal castle constructed in medieval Britain. It was apparently built to defend the Thames Estuary, but historians believe it could have been planned as a bolthole for Edward III to escape the Black Death.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.sub-title: Blackpatch, Sussex: Sussex Ups and Downs.
programme.desc: The team visits a site in the South Downs in West Sussex that was first discovered in the 1920s. The Stone Age landscape is littered with the remains of 6,000-year-old flint mines, and the experts believe it could include a Neolithic settlement, making it one of the rarest examples in Britain.(n)

programme.title: Vet on the Hill
programme.desc: Scott Miller tends a parakeet with a broken leg and a much-loved cat that needs its thyroid gland removed, while the vet's own puppy is rushed in after swallowing a baby's dummy.(n)

programme.title: George Clarke's Amazing Spaces
programme.desc: The architect heads off to Italy, where it seems the residents have also been bitten by the `small buildings are beautiful' bug. The most spectacular place he visits is so high up in the mountains that it's only accessible by helicopter, but this difficulty is more than made up for by the views seen from it. Back in Britain, George meets a man turning a wrecked private jet into a crash pad and a Gypsy tattoo artist with big plans for an old railway carriage. George also challenges his pal, craftsman Will Hardie, to create a woodland retreat for less than the price of a family holiday.(n)

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Pru and Richard Irvine decide to build a family home on an old industrial site in the Midlothian countryside, but will only be allowed to go ahead if their house blends in with the landscape. Unfortunately, the modern property they envisage could be considered an eyesore by the conservative locals and they underestimate the long hours needed to manage the project. Kevin McCloud monitors their progress.(n)

programme.title: All Gardens Great and Small
programme.desc: New series. Plantswoman Dee Hart Dyke travels around Britain meeting people opening their gardens to visitors through the National Garden Scheme, as well as trying to convert her daughter Miranda Hart to the joys of gardening. In the first episode, Dee meets a woman who is preparing to open her small urban garden for the very first time, while Julian Clary shows her around the Kent garden he has lovingly restored. Narrated by Miranda Hart.(n)

programme.title: Walks with My Dog
programme.desc: Location, Location, Location's Phil Spencer takes his cocker spaniels out in Windsor Great Park, while BBC Radio 4 presenter Clive Anderson tours the Isle of Mull with his terrier. Meanwhile, Katy Brand and her own beloved pooch amble through Constable country, as she sets out to explore the landscape that inspired the renowned painter.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Staff and patients at St George's in south west London talk about the importance of family support when dealing with difficult circumstances. Fifty-one-year-old painter and decorator Gary is rushed to St George's after falling 10 feet from a ladder. Cameras also follow five-year-old Beatriz, who has symptoms of a fever. She has a rare kidney condition that affects her immune system, making her vulnerable to infection.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Chef Gordon Ramsay heads to the Greek at the Harbour restaurant in southern California, where owner Makis Mikelatos works 17 hours a day, seven days a week, but is unwilling to let his son Ari take the reins. Gordon sets out to get to the bottom of Makis's reluctance to teach his son, and uncovers a shocking family secret.(n)

programme.title: All Gardens Great and Small
programme.desc: New series. Plantswoman Dee Hart Dyke travels around Britain meeting people opening their gardens to visitors through the National Garden Scheme, as well as trying to convert her daughter Miranda Hart to the joys of gardening. Unfortunately, the modern property they envisage could be considered an eyesore by the conservative locals and they underestimate the long hours needed to manage the project. Kevin McCloud monitors their progress.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Uncut
programme.desc: Team captains Jon Richardson and Sean Lock are joined by comedians Johnny Vegas and Joe Lycett, actress Jennifer Metcalfe and Joey Essex from reality series The Only Way Is Essex to answer questions based on opinion polls carried out around the country. Irreverent panel show, hosted by Jimmy Carr.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Laura Hamilton and Jasmine Harman help recently widowed Jan decide whether to spend her £100,000 budget on a house near to her sister in Kent, or a renovation project to keep her busy in Abruzzo, Italy.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: A range of properties in Bournemouth, Dorset, and Sicily provide food for thought for Paul and Chris, the owners of a B&B in northern France who are ready for a slower pace of life in a different country.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contest begins at North Bridge Street B&B in Hawick in the Scottish Borders, which is run by Eileen Walsh and her Portuguese partner Emanuel Forte. When the guests arrive, the purple-themed rooms cause a reaction, while one competitor's constant criticising irritates another.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contest continues at the Golden Fleece in Ruleholme, Cumbria, run by chef Robert Cowan and his partner, Sylvia Spark. Before long, guests Eileen and Emmanuel pick up on cleanliness issues, and breakfast proves to be a disappointment.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants travel to the Bubble Inn in Stenson, Derbyshire for the third day of the competition, where unsightly stains and security leave some of them less than impressed. Manager and ex-semi-professional boxer Connie Eleftheriou is keen to take his rivals in the ring with him, however the real damage happens when Emmanuel is taken to hospital after some overenthusiastic dancing at a Greek-themed night.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Melinda Beckett-Hughes is the final host of the week at Ayuda House in Greater Manchester - and as she has spent the week picking fault, the guests expect perfection from her. However, Robert and Sylvia are shocked to find a dirty towel in a drawer, while Emmanuel and Eileen cannot believe the levels of dust and Connie is horrified by the carpet.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B owners meet for the last time to find out what they have been paid and settle some old scores. Eileen and Emmanuel from North Bridge Street want to get to the bottom of Melinda and Stewart's dirty bin comments as well as challenging Melinda's shower issues. Robert and Sylvia from the Golden Fleece try to defend their breakfast disaster, but also pull Eileen and Emmanuel up on their low score.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin and Laura Hamilton come to the aid of creative couple Victor and Penny from London. The pair are searching for a relaxing getaway and must choose between buying a home in Kent, which would make for an easy weekend commute, or finding a property in Penny's preferred location, Florence in Italy.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Newly married couple Ed and Clare are planning to start a family soon and will need a larger home. Ed wants to raise his family where he grew up in Lunigiana, Italy, so Jonnie Irwin finds some rural properties within their £250,000 budget. However, Clare wants to remain close to her relatives, so asks Laura Hamilton to find them suitable properties in the Sevenoaks area of Kent.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.sub-title: Islip, Oxfordshire: Birthplace of the Confessor.
programme.desc: The villagers of Islip in Oxfordshire invite the team to help them find a medieval chapel dedicated to famous former resident Edward the Confessor. The king ruled the country for 24 years, and was responsible for building Westminster Abbey, which the team also visits to search in the archives.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the team head to Ffrith in north Wales in search of the remains of a Roman mining town. The signs are good, with an excavation in 1960 revealing a bath house, but just as the well-kept gardens are being turned into archaeology trenches, the weather begins to conspire against them.(n)

programme.title: Vet on the Hill
programme.desc: Dr Scott tackles a sphynx cat that has become a frisky pest due to raging hormones and Scott goes to Sheffield to meet a remarkable teenage animal activist.(n)

programme.title: George Clarke's Amazing Spaces
programme.desc: The architect heads off to Italy, where it seems the residents have also been bitten by the `small buildings are beautiful' bug. The most spectacular place he visits is so high up in the mountains that it's only accessible by helicopter, but this difficulty is more than made up for by the views seen from it. programme.title: Craft It Yourself
programme.desc: The team crafts a living room by using different shades and tones of one colour. While Ant Anstead and Clem Green get creative with tie-dye, Robin Johnson makes a vase out of paper.(n)

programme.title: The Yorkshire Dales and the Lakes
programme.desc: Cameras follow events at the Dales' Tan Hill Inn, Britain's highest pub, and at Muncaster Castle in the Lakes, where the library ceiling needs repair work. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Our Guy in India
programme.desc: Part two of two. Guy Martin visits Mumbai, where more skyscrapers are being built than anywhere else in the world, and clambers 833ft to the top of India's tallest building, the Imperial. Back on ground level, the daredevil visits a slum where a million people live in the space of one square mile, before experiencing a downpour on his Royal Enfield with the arrival of the monsoons. To avoid slow-moving and dangerous roads, he makes the final leg of his 1,000-mile journey by sea, on his way to compete in Rider Mania.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Chef Gordon Ramsay heads to Mike & Nellie's Steakhouse in Oakhurst, New Jersey, where owner Mike Farber is mourning his father Nellie, who was also his business partner. Having been called in by the restaurateur's two daughters, Gordon faces the task of getting him to focus on his business, before tackling the bigger problem of rotting decor and a less-than-appealing menu.(n)

programme.title: Swamp Men
programme.desc: Most Wanted. Park Director Brian Zepeda decides to bring Trump, the park's most notorious alligator, onto Safari's compound to keep closer tabs on the aging reptile. While preparing to move Trump to a new enclosure, Onebear and Cattail discover an abscess that requires surgery. In order to make way for Trump, the guys must relocate Bad, an elusive alligator who quickly lives up to his reputation as an aggressive reptile. On moving day, the guys experience what it's like to transport Trump - an alligator that weighs more than 800 pounds. On the other side of the park, Steve embarks on a mission to bring water to an area known as Alcatraz. Florida's severe drought has meant dangerously low water levels in this enclosure that serves as safe haven for large nuisance gators. New employee Manny gets an exciting hands-on lesson in handling alligators from Seminole tribal member Billy Walker. With Trump safely in his new enclosure, Onebear and Cattail return to the pond to rescue his babies(n)

programme.title: Swamp Men
programme.desc: Gator Beatdown. A nuisance alligator has taken over a Seminole fishing spot. Tribe wildlife officers, 'Onebear' Batista and Jonathan 'Cattail' Vazquez, are determined to remove the clever gator, even if it means going to unexpected extremes. Meanwhile, Billie Swamp Safari prepares the grounds and staff for their first ever Arbor Day celebration. Park Director Brian Zepeda puts his tour guides to the test, setting up a difficult swamp buggy driving course, finding out which driver is the best and who needs more work. Just days before the celebration begins, an employee is attacked by bees near a guest hut. Brian quickly calls in a bee wrangler hoping to remove the unwanted guests before the real guests check in. Across the park, employees Rey and Tatika notice that a rehabilitated hawk has returned looking for food. Assuming the hawk must be caring for young, Rey tracks down the nest, only to discover what looks like a baby hawk that isn't breathing. While Rey moves in for a closer look, One Bear and Cattail come to the park to release three captive-born, baby green-backed herons(n)

programme.title: Motorway Patrol
programme.desc: Documentary following members of the New Zealand highway patrol as they witness some of the best and worst behaviour on the nation's motorways. The series is centred around the roads of Auckland, the country's largest urban area, and features motoring chaos including major traffic collisions, escaped animals and pedestrians on busy roads. There is also footage of drivers falling asleep at the wheel, overloaded vehicles and suspects caught with illegal substances - plus a host of excuses as the people pulled over try to persuade officers they have not done anything wrong.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef

For the main, he asks for a classic British dish or a genuine Indian one, and for the dessert, insists on a pudding that the customer finds overwhelming. Hidden among her cryptic body ink is the name of hardened FBI agent Kurt Weller, and as he and his team begin to decode the map of clues etched onto her skin, they discover that each tattoo contains clues to a crime they must solve. programme.desc: The actor heads to Tokyo and checks out the Park Hyatt, the hotel featured in the film Lost in Translation, and goes behind the closed doors of the Japanese capital's love hotels. In the fashionable district of Meguro, Richard takes in the Claska, which was the city's first boutique hotel and has its own canine beauty salon.(n)

programme.title: Richard E Grant's Hotel Secrets
programme.desc: Richard E Grant travels to Venice, said to be the city with the highest concentration of luxury hotels on the planet. He discovers how a measuring error led to the building of the city's biggest swimming pool, tries out a 15,000 euro-a-night royal suite whose bed has been slept in by everyone from the Beckhams to Prince Charles and the Duchess of Cornwall, and visits a hotel that keeps its doors open even when water floods to knee height. He also finds out why breaking a window once earned Ernest Hemingway a 10 per cent discount on his room.(n)

programme.title: The British
programme.desc: How the Norman Conquest in 1066 transformed Britain, as William the Conqueror sought to assert his power over the whole of England by dismantling the Anglo-Saxon aristocracy and crushing regional diversity. The programme explores the human cost of his campaign and the lasting legacy of the social structures established by the Normans, and explains how a spirit of resistance began to foment among the population. Dramatic reconstructions also reveal how the longbow was instrumental in Henry V's famous victory at the battle of Agincourt in 1415. With contributions by Tim Roth, Jeremy Irons, Micky Flanagan and Tracey Emin.(n)

programme.title: The British
programme.desc: How Britain changed during the reign of the Tudor and Stuart monarchs. The programme explores the battles that established England as one of the world's leading naval powers and delves into Henry VIII's feud with the Catholic Church, revealing how he tried to silence dissenting voices. Contributors including Helen Mirren and Ben Kingsley also discover how literature from the period sowed the seeds of revolution, and learn why a riot organised from a prison cell laid the foundations for civil war.(n)

programme.title: The West Wing
programme.desc: The president Elect undermines President Bartlet by speaking to the head of authority in China and offering him a different viewpoint. Meanwhile, Josh chooses his deputy chief of staff. Guest starring former regular Rob Lowe.(n)

programme.title: The British
programme.desc: How money drove the making of modern Britain, exploring its role in the rebuilding of London following the Great Fire of 1666. The programme investigates how underhanded deals brokered in coffee houses fuelled British prosperity, and exposes how the country profited from dubious practices, including the slave trade, the sex industry and global colonisation. It also explores those who rebelled against the status quo during the period, and discovers how the armed forces countered the threat posed by Napoleon Bonaparte. With contributions by Jeremy Irons, Frank Lampard and Terry Wogan.(n)

programme.title: The British
programme.desc: The expansion of Britain's empire through exploration and invention as the Industrial Revolution transformed society and the economy - though the rise of mechanised factories was not welcomed by all. The programme also explores the colonisation of Australia and the advances in 19th-century technology that turned the Crimean War into one of the most brutal conflicts in military history. With contributions by Jessie J, Lily Cole and Dougray Scott.(n)

programme.desc: Experience has taught the BAU that the first 24 hours are critical in child abduction cases, so it's straight on board a plane to Mississippi, where a distraught mother has a bone to pick with the relative who was supposed to be looking after her four-year-old daughter. However, the profilers are more interested in finding out why little Gabby's father has suddenly gone off the grid.(n)

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The FBI agents are drawn into the Nevada desert when two women are found drowned, and evidence left at the scene indicates the killer has eight more targets. Meanwhile, Reid uses the trip as a chance to catch up with his mother to see how she is coping with her mental health issues. Drama, starring Joe Mantegna and Matthew Gray Gubler.(n)

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The FBI agents are drawn to Milwaukee when several bodies covered with bite marks and infected with rabies are discovered in a park. Meanwhile, Reid and Garcia work out for a company fitness test, but try to hide their preparations from Morgan. Drama, starring Joe Mantegna and Matthew Gray Gubler.(n)

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: Brennan's theories about the Ghost Killer start to gain traction following the discovery of a young heiress's body bearing the murderer's signature. Upon noticing the missing fingernail, Cam bars Brennan from the case, knowing she won't be objective, bringing in Dr Clark to oversee instead. But the scientist can't keep away - and unearths an unexpected link to another incident, as well as a secret that has huge ramifications.(n)

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: Sweets ruffles Brennan's feathers when he takes Booth's place in an investigation into a murdered swimming coach who had a secret after-hours career. Meanwhile, competitive new intern Jessica (Laura Spencer, The Big Bang Theory) seems more interested in checking out her colleagues than examining evidence.(n)

programme.title: Limitless
programme.desc: Brian and Rebecca wind up in quarantine after they are exposed to a mysterious substance during an investigation into a suspicious city-wide power cut. Later, Rebecca starts to doubt her trust in Brian when she catches him taking pills from his secret supply of NZT.(n)

programme.title: Elementary
programme.desc: Holmes is suspended from the NYPD after his deadly altercation with M, but that doesn't stop him investigating the suspicious death of a conspiracy theorist. The victim was convinced that a war game devised by the army to simulate clashes between the US and its enemies is a front for classified military operations, and the detective believes he might well have been on to something.(n)

programme.title: The Real A&E
programme.desc: A postman is bitten by a dog and an ice hockey player loses consciousness when he hits his head on the rink.(n)

programme.title: The Real A&E
programme.desc: Champion jockey Jacqueline Coward is airlifted to hospital following a serious fall, while doctors fear a 13-year-old is displaying the symptoms of a rare disease.(n)

programme.title: Nothing to Declare
programme.desc: Fly-on-the-wall documentary accessing the world of national security at Australia's biggest airports as customs and immigration officers tackle drug runners, illegal immigrants and terrorists.(n)

programme.title: Road Wars
programme.desc: Police officers use unmarked cars fitted with on-board video cameras, offering an insight into vehicle crime and how it can be prevented. The programme also features footage of dangerous drivers.(n)

programme.title: My Kitchen Rules: Australia
programme.desc: New series. Judges Pete Evans and Manu Feildel return to oversee another bout of competitive cooking. First up are Damo and Caz, who open up their instant restaurant, Sound Check.(n)

programme.title: Border Security USA
programme.desc: A routine drug search in New York turns into a race to save a man's life, and officers in Miami are forced to evacuate an airport terminal.(n)

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: Gideon faces his biggest challenge yet when he tries to persuade a cornered sadistic murderer to reveal the location of a woman he has abducted. Starring Mandy Patinkin and Thomas Gibson.(n)

programme.title: Cold Case
programme.desc: A nurse's confession to committing euthanasia six times prompts the team to reopen the 1998 case of a terminally ill man who died months before he was expected to. Crime drama, starring Kathryn Morris and Meredith Baxter.(n)

programme.title: Cooks to Market
programme.desc: Gizzi Erskine and James Averdieck host a culinary competition in which two pairs of cooks are each given £250 to create home-made food on a commercial scale. The winners then pitch their products to a panel of executives and investors from prestigious companies in a bid to become a household brand.(n)

programme.title: Stop, Search, Seize
programme.desc: Documentary following the work of Ireland's border force officers as they fight to stop gangs of organised smugglers from bringing drugs, money, guns, cars and even exotic animals into the country.(n)

programme.title: UK Border Force
programme.desc: An immigration officer clashes with her boss, and customs staff target travellers trying to smuggle illicit goods.(n)

programme.title: Nothing to Declare UK

programme.title: My Kitchen Rules: Australia
programme.desc: Two more contestants transform their homes into pop-up restaurants, working to change the decor and come up with a three-course meals for the judges and their rivals to score.(n)

programme.title: Elementary
programme.desc: A serial killer who stalked and skinned his victims escapes from police custody while in hospital, and Holmes has his hands full while investigating the case when the NYPD hires one of his ex-lovers, an FBI profiler, to help capture the fugitive. With Kari Matchett (Covert Affairs) and Terry Kinney (Oz).(n)

programme.title: Chicago Fire
programme.desc: Family matters concern the team as Gabriela and Antonio's parents come to Chicago to celebrate their anniversary, and Chief Boden discovers a secret about his stepson.(n)

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: Unanswered questions surrounding an old murder case lie heavy on Morgan's mind, prompting him to look for definitive answers. The search takes him to New York, where a key witness resides in a mental-health facility. It comes to light the killer had an accomplice who was never caught, and with justice long overdue, the agents set about finding the vigilante, only to be thrown a curveball as they near their target.(n)

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: After discovering a pair of dead bodies in a rural area of West Virginia, the agents unearth a long-simmering feud between two local families and suspect one side is responsible for the murders - but which? Tobin Bell (the Saw films) guest stars in an episode directed by Matthew Gray Gubler, Criminal Minds' own Spencer Reid.(n)

programme.title: Police Academy 6: City Under Siege
programme.desc: The clueless cops return yet again, this time to thwart the machinations of a crime lord behind a wave of raids and robberies in the city. Unfortunately, they are unaware Mr Big is always one step ahead thanks to a police informer. Penultimate entry in the comedy series, starring Bubba Smith, David Graf, Michael Winslow, Matt McCoy and Leslie Easterbrook.(n)

programme.title: In Her Shoes
programme.desc: Two sisters have little in common - one is a financially irresponsible flirt and the other is a mature and staid lawyer. However, the pair are brought together when a dark family secret comes to light. Curtis Hanson's comedy drama, based on a novel by Jennifer Weiner, starring Cameron Diaz, Toni Collette and Shirley MacLaine.(n)

programme.title: Mistress America
programme.desc: A lonely student finds her first year at university in New York a disappointing experience, with uninspiring studies and no social life. Everything changes when her mother remarries and she acquires a new stepsister, whose bizarre schemes draw her into the kind of lifestyle she had always dreamed of - and provide fresh creative inspiration. Comedy, starring Lola Kirke and Greta Gerwig.(n)

programme.title: Get a Job
programme.desc: Two college graduates faced with the prospect of deciding what to do with their lives find themselves faced with a more immediate crisis - getting and keeping a job. Their search for employment takes them through a succession of strange experiences and even stranger workplaces. Comedy, starring Miles Teller, Anna Kendrick, Bryan Cranston and Alison Brie.(n)

programme.title: The Top Ten Show
programme.desc: Clips from the UK and US Top Ten show you the best of what's on offer on the big screen.(n)

programme.title: Dad's Army
programme.desc: The officious captain of a seaside town's home guard platoon tries to maintain the reputation and morale of his troops as the Second World War draws to a close. He finds himself dealing with the hunt for a German spy as well as a female journalist sent to report on the exploits of the brave but bumbling soldiers. Comedy based on the TV series, starring Toby Jones, Bill Nighy and Catherine Zeta-Jones.(n)

programme.title: Hot Tub Time Machine
programme.desc: A man suffering a midlife crisis tries to recapture his lost youth by going back to his old haunts with two equally unhappy friends and his teenage nephew. They end up being transported back to 1986 and are tempted to give themselves the lives they always wanted - despite warnings that they must not change anything. Sci-fi comedy, starring John Cusack, Clark Duke, Craig Robinson and Rob Corddry.(n)

programme.title: Back to the Future Part III
programme.desc: Time-travelling teenager Marty McFly is transported back to the days of the Wild West, where he strives to save his eccentric scientist friend Doc Brown from death at the hands of a villainous gunslinger. Final instalment in the sci-fi comedy trilogy, starring Michael J Fox, Christopher Lloyd, Mary Steenburgen and Thomas F Wilson.(n)

programme.title: Dad's Army

He finds himself dealing with the hunt for a German spy as well as a female journalist sent to report on the exploits of the brave but bumbling soldiers. Comedy based on the TV series, starring Toby Jones, Bill Nighy and Catherine Zeta-Jones.(n)

Sci-fi comedy, starring John Cusack, Clark Duke, Craig Robinson and Rob Corddry.(n)

programme.title: The Blues Brothers
programme.desc: Two criminal brothers discover the orphanage where they were raised faces closure unless the nuns who run it can pay their tax bill, so the pair embark on an urgent mission to revive their old blues band to raise the money needed. Comedy, starring John Belushi, Dan Aykroyd, Aretha Franklin, James Brown, Ray Charles, Cab Calloway, Carrie Fisher, John Candy and John Lee Hooker.(n)

programme.title: The Heartbreak Kid
programme.desc: A 40-year-old bachelor decides he has been far too picky in his love life, so he hastily proposes to his girlfriend of several weeks. The future looks rosy as they jet off on their honeymoon, but when he discovers an unpleasant side to his new wife's personality he is tempted to look elsewhere for romance. The Farrelly brothers' comedy, starring Ben Stiller, Michelle Monaghan and Malin Akerman.(n)

programme.title: Jackass: The Movie
programme.desc: Johnny Knoxville and his gang of daredevil friends bring the MTV series to the big screen. As usual, they perform a variety of weird and wonderful stunts, including crawling across dozens of mousetraps while wearing rodent make-up, and being rolled down bowling lanes on skateboards. Comedy, with Bam Margera, Henry Rollins, Spike Jonze and Tony Hawk.(n)

programme.title: Big Daddy
programme.desc: An immature 32-year-old is heartbroken when his girlfriend walks out on him. In a plan to win her back, he volunteers to look after his flatmate's five-year-old son, thus demonstrating he is finally ready to grow up. However, his ideas of childcare prove unconventional and chaos quickly ensues. Comedy, with Adam Sandler, Joey Lauren Adams, Jon Stewart, Josh Mostel, Leslie Mann, Rob Schneider and Kristy Swanson, alongside Steve Buscemi in a cameo role.(n)

programme.title: War for the Planet of the Apes: Special
programme.desc: A behind-the-scenes look at the sci-fi action sequel, starring Andy Serkis, Woody Harrelson and Steve Zahn.(n)

programme.title: Ghostbusters: Special
programme.desc: The making of the long-awaited horror comedy reboot, including interviews with Melissa McCarthy and the rest of the cast.(n)

programme.title: Three Amigos
programme.desc: Three silent Western movie stars are summoned to Mexico for what they think will be a public appearance - only to discover the locals really believe in their heroic abilities and expect them to rid their town of a group of evil bandits. Comedy, starring Steve Martin, Chevy Chase and Martin Short.(n)

programme.title: Hot Shots
programme.desc: A pilot joins an elite squad to take part in a dangerous mission, but faces a struggle to live down his father's bad reputation - and win the love of a glamorous psychiatrist. Comedy spoofing action movies - principally Top Gun - starring Charlie Sheen, Lloyd Bridges, Valeria Golino, Cary Elwes, Kevin Dunn and William O'Leary.(n)

programme.title: War for the Planet of the Apes: Special
programme.desc: A behind-the-scenes look at the sci-fi action sequel, starring Andy Serkis, Woody Harrelson and Steve Zahn.(n)

programme.title: Welcome to Me
programme.desc: A mentally unstable woman whose life revolves entirely around daytime TV wins the lottery. She immediately stops taking her medication and pays a television studio millions to let her broadcast a show sharing her outlandish views and troubled past with the world. Comedy, starring Kristen Wiig and Tim Robbins.(n)

programme.title: Sisters
programme.desc: Two estranged sisters are reunited when their parents decide to sell the house they grew up in. They return to the family home to clear out their childhood bedrooms, but with their parents away, seize the chance to relive their teenage years and throw one last wild house party. Comedy, starring Amy Poehler, Tina Fey and Dianne Wiest.(n)

programme.title: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: A disorganised woman is asked to be maid of honour at her best friend's wedding. Taking charge of the prenuptial bridal celebrations, she resolves to give her pal and accompanying bridesmaids the time of their lives, but as her efforts slide into chaos she finds the wife of the groom's boss is keen to usurp her position. Comedy, with Kristen Wiig, Rose Byrne and Melissa McCarthy.(n)

programme.title: Keanu
programme.desc: When thugs steal Keanu the cat, two mild-mannered cousins pose as deadly assassins to get the beloved feline back. Action comedy, starring Jordan Peele, Keegan-Michael Key and Tiffany Haddish.(n)

programme.title: Ghostbusters
programme.desc: Three eccentric scientists put their hi-tech gadgetry and knowledge of the paranormal to money-making use by setting up in business as freelance ghost catchers. A musician calls them in to investigate when she sees strange creatures in her kitchen, only to end up possessed. As the spook-hunting team members deal with an attempt to shut their operation down, they discover an evil demonic entity is being summoned into existence and it falls to them to stop this creature from destroying the world. Supernatural comedy adventure, starring Bill Murray, Dan Aykroyd, Harold Ramis, Sigourney Weaver, Ernie Hudson and Rick Moranis.(n)

programme.title: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: A disorganised woman is asked to be maid of honour at her best friend's wedding. programme.title: In Search of the Castaways
programme.desc: The two children of a missing sea captain receive a message in a bottle that convinces them their father is still alive. Enlisting an eccentric French professor to help them find him, they embark on round-the-world journey and face natural disasters and mutineers during the voyage. Children's adventure based on a novel by Jules Verne, starring Maurice Chevalier, Hayley Mills and George Sanders.(n)

programme.title: The Good Dinosaur
programme.desc: In a world where the asteroid impact that wiped out the dinosaurs never happened, humans have evolved as a primitive species while the giant lizards remain the dominant life form on Earth. A young apatosaurus becomes separated from his family, but finds a friend in a feral human boy as he makes the dangerous journey home. Pixar animated adventure, with the voices of Raymond Ochoa and Jack Bright.(n)

programme.title: Queen Of Katwe
programme.desc: The life of a poor Ugandan youngster is changed forever when she is introduced to the game of chess. Drama, starring David Oyelowo, Lupita Nyong'o and Madina Nalwanga.(n)

programme.title: The Jungle Book
programme.desc: A boy is raised by animals in the jungles of India, but his carefree life is threatened by the return of a fierce tiger with a grudge against humans. The youngster faces a difficult choice between remaining with his friends or returning to his own people. Live action remake of Disney's animated adventure based on Rudyard Kipling's stories, starring Neel Sethi, with the voices of Bill Murray, Ben Kingsley and Idris Elba.(n)

programme.title: Brave
programme.desc: A princess defies her mother's plans to secure peace by marrying her off to the son of one of their allies. A witch provides the rebellious royal with a magic spell to change her fate, but the enchantment backfires disastrously when the queen is transformed into a bear. Pixar's animated fantasy, with the voices of Kelly Macdonald, Emma Thompson and Billy Connolly.(n)

programme.title: Tinker Bell and the Secret of the Wings
programme.desc: The fairy becomes curious about the mysterious winter forest where fairies never dare to go. She travels into the cold woods, where she meets a new friend and uncovers a threat to both their homes that they must work together to prevent. Disney animated adventure, with the voices of Mae Whitman, Lucy Hale, Anjelica Huston and Timothy Dalton.(n)

programme.title: The Good Dinosaur
programme.desc: In a world where the asteroid impact that wiped out the dinosaurs never happened, humans have evolved as a primitive species while the giant lizards remain the dominant life form on Earth. Pixar animated adventure, with the voices of Raymond Ochoa and Jack Bright.(n)

programme.title: Tarzan
programme.desc: A man raised by gorillas in the jungle has his first encounter with humans in the form of a scientist and his daughter, and is torn between remaining among the apes or rediscovering his roots. He must also fight to defend his animal friends from a big-game hunter. Disney animated adventure, with the voices of Tony Goldwyn and Minnie Driver.(n)

programme.title: The Shaggy DA
programme.desc: A boy who once turned into a dog grows up to become a principled lawyer, who runs for district attorney. However, as he campaigns against the crooked current DA, he finds himself once again undergoing a canine transformation and must find out the cause while keeping his condition a secret. Sequel to Disney comedy The Shaggy Dog, starring Dean Jones and Suzanne Pleshette.(n)

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: A bumbling, short-sighted senior citizen unwittingly ends up in the possession of a valuable jewel during a mix-up at a museum exhibition, and is blissfully unaware that a Brazilian crime lord, a female cat burglar and the FBI are on his tail. Comedy based on the cartoon series, starring Leslie Nielsen, Kelly Lynch, Malcolm McDowell, Ernie Hudson and Jennifer Garner.(n)

programme.title: The Great Mouse Detective
programme.desc: The evil Professor Ratigan masterminds a cunning plan to become supreme ruler of all mousedom by kidnapping a clever toy-maker and forcing him to participate in his evil schemes - but super-sleuth Basil of Baker Street is soon on the case. Animated adventure, with the voices of Vincent Price, Barrie Ingham, Val Bettin and Alan Young.(n)

programme.title: Lady and the Tramp
programme.desc: A pet cocker spaniel fears her owners will reject her when they become parents, and the arrival of two villainous siamese cats in the house leaves her feeling more unwelcome. Driven from her home, she encounters a roguish stray mongrel, who introduces her to his carefree life on the streets. Disney animated adventure, with the voices of Barbara Luddy, Larry Roberts and Peggy Lee.(n)

programme.title: Lady and the Tramp II: Scamp's Adventure
programme.desc: The son of the canine couple leaves home to join a pack of rough-and-ready strays, but he soon discovers the grass is not always greener on the other side. Animated sequel, with the voices of Scott Wolf, Alyssa Milano, Jodi Benson and Jeff Bennett.(n)

programme.title: Bambi
programme.desc: A young deer grows up in the forest, forming close friendships with other woodland creatures. When tragedy strikes, he is suddenly forced to fend for himself but ultimately becomes brave and resourceful enough to save his friends during a forest fire. Animated drama, with the voices of Bobby Stewart, Hardie Albright and Donnie Dunagan.(n)

programme.title: Bambi II
programme.desc: The young fawn is reunited with his father, a wise stag, in the aftermath of his mother's death. The older animal reluctantly takes on his parental responsibilities, teaching his son the ways of the forest and helping him find the courage to face the challenges ahead. Disney animated prequel, with the voices of Patrick Stewart and Alexander Gould.(n)

programme.title: Ratatouille
programme.desc: A rat finds his love of fine food has made him an outcast to his less discerning family. Separated from his fellow rodents by a storm, he winds up in a famous French restaurant, where he helps an incompetent kitchen assistant become the greatest chef in Paris. Pixar animated comedy from the director of The Incredibles, with the voices of Patton Oswalt, Ian Holm, Lou Romano and Peter O'Toole.(n)

Pixar animated comedy from the director of The Incredibles, with the voices of Patton Oswalt, Ian Holm, Lou Romano and Peter O'Toole.(n)

programme.title: Glory Road
programme.desc: A basketball coach takes over a college team in 1960s Texas, but his decision to recruit black people causes uproar. Determined to enlist the best players possible, he sets out to lead his team to the national championships. Sporting drama based on a true story, starring Josh Lucas, Jon Voight and Derek Luke.(n)

programme.title: The Love Bug
programme.desc: Herbie, an irrepressible Beetle car with a mind of its own, takes a shine to a struggling racing driver and leads him to victory on the track. However, his success attracts the attention of an unscrupulous rival competitor, who will go to any lengths to win the most important race of all. Disney comedy, starring Dean Jones, Michele Lee, Buddy Hackett and David Tomlinson.(n)

programme.title: Never Cry Wolf
programme.desc: Fact-based drama about a Canadian author who embarked on a solitary journey into the Arctic to study the behaviour of wolves, convinced they posed a real threat to humankind - only to be shocked by his findings. Starring Charles Martin Smith and Brian Dennehy.(n)

programme.title: Battle of the Bulge
programme.desc: A German tank commander is assigned to lead a surprise counter-attack against Allied forces as part of a last-ditch attempt to turn the tide of the Second World War and prevent the invasion of his country. An American intelligence officer realises what the enemy is planning, and tries to convince his superiors that they are facing a major offensive. Drama, starring Robert Shaw, Henry Fonda, Dana Andrews, Telly Savalas and Charles Bronson.(n)

programme.title: In the Heart of the Sea
programme.desc: A whaling ship sets sail from New England in 1820, only to come under attack from a gigantic whale that seems to want revenge on them. In the aftermath of the attack, the surviving members of the crew face further physical and moral challenges as they try to stay alive on the open sea. Fact-based historical adventure, starring Chris Hemsworth, Cillian Murphy and Ben Whishaw.(n)

programme.title: Warcraft
programme.desc: Conflict erupts between the defenders of a kingdom and an invading horde that has travelled from a dying world. Fantasy adventure based on the best-selling computer game, starring Travis Fimmel, Paula Patton and Ben Foster.(n)

programme.title: The Italian Job
programme.desc: A crook double-crosses his partners in crime, a betrayal that leaves their friend and mentor dead. One year later, they regroup and come up with a daring plan to exact revenge on the traitor and reclaim their ill-gotten gains. Crime thriller inspired by the 1969 movie, starring Mark Wahlberg, Charlize Theron, Edward Norton, Seth Green and Donald Sutherland.(n)

programme.title: The Great Escape
programme.desc: The most rebellious Allied prisoners of war are sent to a supposedly escape-proof maximum-security detention camp during the Second World War. They plan an ingenious mass breakout by digging a tunnel, but even when free of the camp, making it across occupied Europe proves a dangerous journey. Drama, starring Steve McQueen, James Coburn, Donald Pleasence, James Garner, Charles Bronson and Richard Attenborough.(n)

programme.title: Rocky II
programme.desc: Philadelphia boxer Rocky Balboa quits the ring to marry his sweetheart and become a father. However, times prove hard and money is tight, so when Balboa is offered another shot at Apollo Creed's heavyweight title, the fighter is lured out of retirement. Drama sequel, starring Sylvester Stallone, Talia Shire, Carl Weathers, Burt Young and Burgess Meredith.(n)

programme.title: In the Heart of the Sea
programme.desc: A whaling ship sets sail from New England in 1820, only to come under attack from a gigantic whale that seems to want revenge on them. In the aftermath of the attack, the surviving members of the crew face further physical and moral challenges as they try to stay alive on the open sea. Fact-based historical adventure, starring Chris Hemsworth, Cillian Murphy and Ben Whishaw.(n)

programme.title: Warcraft
programme.desc: Conflict erupts between the defenders of a kingdom and an invading horde that has travelled from a dying world. Fantasy adventure based on the best-selling computer game, starring Travis Fimmel, Paula Patton and Ben Foster.(n)

programme.title: The Italian Job
programme.desc: A crook double-crosses his partners in crime, a betrayal that leaves their friend and mentor dead. One year later, they regroup and come up with a daring plan to exact revenge on the traitor and reclaim their ill-gotten gains. Crime thriller inspired by the 1969 movie, starring Mark Wahlberg, Charlize Theron, Edward Norton, Seth Green and Donald Sutherland.(n)

programme.title: Conan the Barbarian
programme.desc: A child who grows up in slavery becomes a formidable warrior and a cunning thief. Taken prisoner by a victorious king, he is sent out to destroy the leader of the barbaric cult that destroyed his village and slaughtered his family. Fantasy adventure, based on the stories by author Robert E Howard, starring Arnold Schwarzenegger, Max von Sydow, James Earl Jones and Sandahl Bergman.(n)

programme.title: Lucky Number Slevin
programme.desc: A case of mistaken identity plunges an ordinary man into the middle of a war between crime syndicates. With no means of proving who he really is, he finds himself forced to pay off a friend's debt to an underworld kingpin by assassinating a rival mobster. Thriller, starring Josh Hartnett, Bruce Willis, Lucy Liu, Morgan Freeman and Ben Kingsley.(n)

programme.title: The Magnificent Seven Ride
programme.desc: The one-time leader of the gunslinging band, now a marshal, turns down an old ally's call for help in dealing with a gang of Mexican bandits. However, when the desperados kill his friend and his own wife, the lawman puts together a new team and sets out to take revenge. Western sequel, with Lee Van Cleef, Stefanie Powers, Mariette Hartley and Michael Callan.(n)

programme.title: Forbidden Kingdom
programme.desc: An English cartographer travelling through 18th century Eastern Europe loses his way in bad weather and finds shelter in a village whose people are living in fear of a mysterious evil force that surrounds the area. Will building a moat around their homes protect them from the malevolent entity, or is it already in their midst? Fantasy adventure, starring Jason Flemyng, Charles Dance and Aleksey Chadov.(n)

programme.title: Ghost Rider
programme.desc: Motorcycle stuntman Johnny Blaze sells his soul to diabolical Mephistopheles to save the life of his father. His bargain dooms him to pass each night as Ghost Rider, a demonic skeletal biker bound to take evil souls to Hell. However, conflict between Mephistopheles and his son offers Johnny the chance to win back his humanity. Fantasy thriller based on the comic-book, starring Nicolas Cage, Eva Mendes and Wes Bentley.(n)

programme.title: 13 Hours: The Secret Soldiers of Benghazi
programme.desc: A US embassy in Libya comes under attack from extremists, who kill the ambassador. With no help in sight, a small band of CIA security operatives from various military backgrounds takes a stand to fight off the attackers and protect the remaining diplomatic personnel. Fact-based action thriller, starring John Krasinski and James Badge Dale.(n)

programme.title: I Am Legend
programme.desc: A Manhattan-based military scientist finds himself immune to a virus that turns humans into ferocious vampire-like creatures. After the disease has swept across the world, wiping out an estimated 90 per cent of the human population, he devotes his solitary existence to finding a cure by unlocking the secret within his blood. Sci-fi thriller, starring Will Smith, Alice Braga and Charlie Tahan.(n)

programme.title: Charlie's Angels
programme.desc: Three private investigators are recruited to rescue a computer genius from the clutches of a rival. They discover there is more at stake than they thought, as the captive genius has created a dangerous piece of software that must not fall into the wrong hands. Action adventure, based on the TV series, starring Cameron Diaz, Drew Barrymore, Lucy Liu and Bill Murray.(n)

programme.title: Charlie's Angels: Full Throttle
programme.desc: The high-kicking trio return, this time to hunt down the villains responsible for stealing two encoded rings containing top-secret information. The case brings them into conflict with a former Angel gone bad, a spurned ex-lover out for revenge and their creepy old enemy the Thin Man. Action adventure sequel, starring Drew Barrymore, Cameron Diaz and Lucy Liu, with Demi Moore, John Cleese and Bernie Mac.(n)

programme.title: Ghost Rider
programme.desc: Motorcycle stuntman Johnny Blaze sells his soul to diabolical Mephistopheles to save the life of his father. His bargain dooms him to pass each night as Ghost Rider, a demonic skeletal biker bound to take evil souls to Hell. However, conflict between Mephistopheles and his son offers Johnny the chance to win back his humanity. Fantasy thriller based on the comic-book, starring Nicolas Cage, Eva Mendes and Wes Bentley.(n)

programme.title: I Am Legend
programme.desc: A Manhattan-based military scientist finds himself immune to a virus that turns humans into ferocious vampire-like creatures. After the disease has swept across the world, wiping out an estimated 90 per cent of the human population, he devotes his solitary existence to finding a cure by unlocking the secret within his blood. Sci-fi thriller, starring Will Smith, Alice Braga and Charlie Tahan.(n)

programme.title: Mean Machine
programme.desc: A disgraced soccer star jailed for assaulting two policemen is persuaded by the prison authorities to form a football team of inmates to take on the guards. Unfortunately, whipping his fellow prisoners into shape proves a tricky proposition. Comedy drama, starring Vinnie Jones, Jason Statham, David Hemmings and Jason Flemyng.(n)

programme.title: The Rock
programme.desc: A renegade general and his crack team of mercenaries take over the abandoned fortress prison of Alcatraz and threaten San Francisco with toxic nerve-gas rockets to extort a massive ransom. To break their stranglehold on the city, the FBI sends in a chemical weapons expert and a jailed SAS veteran, chosen because he is the only man to have ever escaped from the infamous penitentiary. Action thriller, with Sean Connery, Nicolas Cage and Ed Harris.(n)

programme.title: Deep Family Secrets
programme.desc: A girl sets out on a personal quest to discover the truth about her mother's alleged abduction, and uncovers a tangled tale of adultery, incest and murder. Thriller, starring Richard Crenna, Angie Dickinson and Meg Foster.(n)

programme.title: Love Me Do
programme.desc: A female investment banker lets an out-of-work actor into her life for a romantic adventure with chilling results. Drama, starring Jack Gordon, Rebecca Calder and Max Wrottesley.(n)

programme.title: Backtrack
programme.desc: A psychotherapist troubled by strange delusions and recurring nightmares discovers a terrifying secret shared by his patients. The revelation sends him fleeing back to his home town, where he tries to solve a decades-old mystery in the hope that the answer will hold the key to his own issues. Supernatural thriller, starring Adrien Brody and Sam Neill.(n)

programme.title: Fast & Furious
programme.desc: News of a friend's murder brings international fugitive Dominic Toretto back to his home city of Los Angeles in search of revenge. It is not long before his pursuit leads him to cross paths with FBI agent Brian O'Conner, and despite their hostile feelings toward each other, the pair work together to bring down those responsible. Thriller sequel, starring Vin Diesel, Paul Walker, Michelle Rodriguez and Jordana Brewster.(n)

programme.title: Desierto
programme.desc: A group of immigrants hoping to make it across the US-Mexico border are targeted by a deranged, gun-wielding vigilante. Thriller, starring Gael Garcia Bernal and Jeffrey Dean Morgan.(n)

programme.title: Black Rain
programme.desc: Two New York cops arrest a hitman working for the Japanese Mafia, and are ordered to extradite him back to Osaka to stand trial. However, the prisoner gives them the slip on arrival, and as the detectives hunt him down with the aid of local law enforcement officers they become snared in a vicious gang war. Ridley Scott's thriller, starring Michael Douglas, Andy Garcia, Ken Takakura and Yasaku Matsuda.(n)

programme.title: The Prestige
programme.desc: Victorian stage illusionists Robert Angier and Alfred Borden engage in a bitter personal and professional rivalry. The pair resort to increasingly brutal measures to sabotage each other's acts, while Angier becomes obsessed with the secret behind Borden's greatest illusion. Christopher Nolan's mystery thriller, starring Hugh Jackman, Christian Bale, Michael Caine, Piper Perabo and Scarlett Johansson, with David Bowie as real-life scientific pioneer Nikola Tesla.(n)

programme.title: Fast & Furious
programme.desc: News of a friend's murder brings international fugitive Dominic Toretto back to his home city of Los Angeles in search of revenge. It is not long before his pursuit leads him to cross paths with FBI agent Brian O'Conner, and despite their hostile feelings toward each other, the pair work together to bring down those responsible. Thriller sequel, starring Vin Diesel, Paul Walker, Michelle Rodriguez and Jordana Brewster.(n)

programme.title: Desierto
programme.desc: A group of immigrants hoping to make it across the US-Mexico border are targeted by a deranged, gun-wielding vigilante. Thriller, starring Gael Garcia Bernal and Jeffrey Dean Morgan.(n)

programme.title: Fatal Attraction
programme.desc: A married lawyer has a one-night stand with a business associate while his wife and children are out of town. He hopes to keep his infidelity a secret, but she is determined to continue the relationship, and begins obsessively stalking him and his unsuspecting family. Thriller, starring Michael Douglas, Glenn Close and Anne Archer.(n)

programme.title: Black Rain
programme.desc: Two New York cops arrest a hitman working for the Japanese Mafia, and are ordered to extradite him back to Osaka to stand trial. However, the prisoner gives them the slip on arrival, and as the detectives hunt him down with the aid of local law enforcement officers they become snared in a vicious gang war. Ridley Scott's thriller, starring Michael Douglas, Andy Garcia, Ken Takakura and Yasaku Matsuda.(n)

programme.title: True Deception
programme.desc: An author struggling with writer's block and drug addiction becomes fascinated with a high-profile murder trial, especially when a friend of the defendant confesses to murders he probably did not commit. He is determined to find out why he would do such a thing, finding parallels with his own father. Drama based on Stephen Elliot's novel The Adderall Diaries, starring James Franco, Ed Harris, Amber Heard and Christian Slater.(n)

programme.title: Loss of Faith
programme.desc: A crime writer is drawn into intrigue and danger while investigating the kidnapping of a baby boy and the murder of the child's wealthy father. Mystery thriller, starring John Ritter, Michele Scarabelli, Daphne Zuniga and Roddy McDowall.(n)

programme.title: Camino
programme.desc: A photographer ventures deep into the jungles of Colombia to document a group of missionaries. However, when she witnesses the leader of the group committing a horrific crime, she faces a battle for survival to make it back to civilisation with the evidence before his followers have her killed. Action thriller, starring Zoe Bell and Nacho Vigalondo.(n)

programme.title: Anti-Social
programme.desc: Crime drama, following the criminal exploits of anarchic street artist Dee and his violent gang member and jewel thief brother Marcus, who live on a London council estate. Starring Gregg Sulkin and Josh Myers.(n)

programme.title: Collateral Damage
programme.desc: A heroic firefighter is plunged into the world of international terrorism when his wife and child are killed in a horrific attack. Disillusioned with the progress of the official investigation, he decides to take on the villains himself and heads for Colombia on a dangerous mission of revenge, determined to bring the perpetrators to justice. Action thriller, starring Arnold Schwarzenegger, Francesca Neri, Elias Koteas and Cliff Curtis.(n)

programme.title: Exposed
programme.desc: A detective is determined to bring his dead partner's killers to justice, despite warnings from both his superior officers and the murdered man's wife to forget about it. As he delves deeper, he uncovers dangerous secrets and evidence of political corruption, with a devoutly religious woman seemingly the key to the mystery. Crime thriller, starring Keanu Reeves, Ana de Armas and Mira Sorvino.(n)

programme.title: Extraction
programme.desc: A veteran CIA agent is kidnapped by a terrorist organisation. His son, a government analyst turned down for field service, defies his superiors to mount his own rescue mission. He finds himself battling international assassins and top secret agents to save his father and prevent a terror attack. Action thriller, starring Kellan Lutz, Bruce Willis and Gina Carano.(n)

programme.title: Enemy of the State
programme.desc: A chance encounter with an old friend derails a successful lawyer's fast-track career, plunging him headlong into a deadly game of cat and mouse with relentless government agents capable of anticipating his every move. He quickly realises the only way to save his own life is to expose the truths his pursuers seem so intent on covering up, and seeks out a former intelligence agent to take them on at their own game. Thriller, starring Will Smith, Gene Hackman, Jon Voight and Lisa Bonet.(n)

programme.title: The Man from UNCLE
programme.desc: A CIA agent is forced into an uneasy alliance with his arch-rival in the KGB at the height of the Cold War. A criminal organisation is planning to alter the balance of power by making nuclear weapons widely available, and the two spies must work together to foil the plan. Action adventure based on the 1960s TV series, starring Henry Cavill, Armie Hammer, Alicia Vikander and Hugh Grant.(n)

programme.title: Phone Booth
programme.desc: A smart-mouthed PR executive answers a public phone and the caller on the other end warns him that if he hangs up he will be shot. The unseen gunman then puts his target through a tortuous series of mind games, as well as incriminating him in the death of a bystander. Psychological thriller, starring Colin Farrell, Kiefer Sutherland, Katie Holmes and Forest Whitaker.(n)

programme.title: Hanna
programme.desc: A former CIA agent raises his daughter alone in the wilderness of Finland, teaching her to be the world's deadliest assassin. When she turns 16, she is sent to carry out her one intended mission, but as she travels the world in search of her target, she is pursued by a CIA operative with a link to her mysterious past. Action thriller, with Saoirse Ronan, Cate Blanchett and Eric Bana.(n)

programme.title: The Hollow Point
programme.desc: A hard-drinking sheriff and his deputy are pitted against a sadistic cartel hitman. Crime thriller, starring Patrick Wilson, Ian McShane and John Leguizamo.(n)

programme.title: Flirting With Love
programme.desc: Constant distractions hamper a pair of struggling New York actors who retreat to the country to work on a script. Comedy, starring Marisa Tomei, Sam Rockwell and Ivan Martin.(n)

programme.title: Girl on the Edge
programme.desc: A troubled teenage girl struggling to deal with the aftermath of a traumatic event with an online predator is sent to an innovative treatment centre. Drama, with Taylor Spreitler, Peter Coyote and Gil Bellows.(n)

programme.title: Children of a Lesser God
programme.desc: A special education teacher takes up a position at a school for the deaf, and becomes fascinated by a former pupil working as a cleaner. A passionate relationship develops between them, but their connection is strained by his insistence she learn to communicate through speech rather than by sign language. Romantic drama based on Mark Medoff's stage play, starring William Hurt and an Oscar-winning Marlee Matlin.(n)

programme.title: Rain Man
programme.desc: Brash yuppie car dealer Charlie discovers his deceased father has left the family fortune to Raymond, the autistic elder brother he never knew he had. In a bid to get his hands on the money, he tracks down and abducts Raymond - but the ensuing cross-country journey proves to be a profound learning experience. Oscar-winning drama, starring Tom Cruise and Dustin Hoffman, with Valeria Golino, Gerald R Molen and Jack Murdock.(n)

programme.title: Take the Lead
programme.desc: A former professional dancer volunteers to pass on his skills to disruptive students in New York's public schools. At first the teenagers and their teachers are sceptical, but he eventually inspires them and persuades the kids to compete in a prestigious contest - in which his classical training and their love of hip-hop fuse to create an entirely new dance style. Fact-based drama, starring Antonio Banderas, Alfre Woodard and Rob Brown.(n)

programme.title: Hitch
programme.desc: A professional relationship guru, who specialises in offering advice to lonely single men, helps an unlucky-in-love accountant to woo the girl of his dreams. However, when he finds himself falling for a beautiful gossip columnist, his usual charm abandons him and he discovers his expertise counts for nothing. Romantic comedy, with Will Smith, Eva Mendes, Kevin James, Amber Valletta, Julie Ann Emery, Adam Arkin and Michael Rapaport.(n)

programme.title: I Saw the Light
programme.desc: Biopic of influential country singer Hank Williams, exploring his tempestuous marriage and addiction to alcohol and painkillers. With Tom Hiddleston and Elizabeth Olsen.(n)

programme.title: Bridge of Spies
programme.desc: A lawyer in 1950s New York is hired to represent a Soviet spy in a showcase trial designed to demonstrate the fairness of the US justice system. In the face of public condemnation, he argues against the death penalty, a stance that years later leads to his involvement in an exchange of prisoners in East Germany. Steven Spielberg's fact-based Cold War drama, starring Tom Hanks and an Oscar-winning Mark Rylance.(n)

programme.title: The Meddler
programme.desc: A widowed mother moves from New York City to Los Angeles to be with her daughter, but her well-meaning, meddlesome ways drive her offspring up the wall. Comedy-drama, starring Susan Sarandon, Rose Byrne and JK Simmons.(n)

programme.title: The Stanford Prison Experiment
programme.desc: A professor performs a social experiment designed to analyse abusive behaviour. He recruits 24 students and places them in a simulated prison, selecting some of the group to live as guards and some as convicts. The results take an unexpectedly terrifying turn, as power corrupts the guards and makes them indulge in sadistic behaviour. Fact-based drama, starring Billy Crudup and Ezra Miller.(n)

programme.title: St Elmo's Fire
programme.desc: Seven college graduates leave behind the trials of adolescence and meet the responsibilities of the adult world head on as they work to achieve their aspirations and sort out their complicated relationships. Coming-of-age drama, starring Rob Lowe, Demi Moore, Andrew McCarthy, Emilio Estevez, Judd Nelson and Ally Sheedy. Directed by Joel Schumacher.(n)

programme.title: The King and I
programme.desc: The relationship between the powerful King of Siam and a widowed English schoolteacher, recruited to tutor his wives and many children, begins with restrained hostility - but gradually gives way to more tender feelings. Oscar-winning Rodgers and Hammerstein musical, starring Deborah Kerr, Yul Brynner, Rita Moreno, Martin Benson and Terry Saunders.(n)

programme.title: The Top Ten Show
programme.desc: Clips from the UK and US Top Ten show you the best of what's on offer on the big screen.(n)

programme.title: A Promise
programme.desc: A German university graduate becomes the private secretary of a steel magnate in 1912, and an unspoken love develops between him and his employer's younger wife. He is sent overseas on business, but pledges to return in two years - however, the outbreak of the First World War drives them further apart. Romantic period drama based on Stefan Zweig's novel Journey Into the Past, with Rebecca Hall, Richard Madden and Alan Rickman.(n)

programme.title: A Passage to India
programme.desc: A headstrong upper-class Englishwoman accuses an Indian doctor of sexual assault when she visits India for the first time, exposing snobbery and inter-racial tensions during the British Raj. David Lean's period drama, adapted from the EM Forster novel, starring Judy Davis, Victor Banerjee, Peggy Ashcroft, Alec Guinness, Nigel Havers, James Fox, Art Malik and Saeed Jaffrey.(n)

programme.title: The Fisher King
programme.desc: A radio DJ contemplates suicide after a listener embarks on a murderous rampage in response to one of his broadcasts. He is saved by a now-homeless former professor of medieval history, who encourages him to retrieve what he claims is the Holy Grail. When the DJ later learns that he is responsible for his saviour's misfortunes, he feels compelled to make amends. Terry Gilliam's comedy drama, with Robin Williams, Jeff Bridges, Amanda Plummer and Mercedes Ruehl.(n)

programme.title: The Walk
programme.desc: A French acrobat hatches an audacious scheme to carry out his most spectacular performance in 1974. With the aid of his circus mentor and an international team of helpers, he plans to tightrope walk between the towers of the World Trade Centre. Fact-based drama, starring Joseph Gordon-Levitt and Ben Kingsley.(n)

programme.title: McFarland, USA
programme.desc: A former American football coach takes a job at an underprivileged school with a mostly Hispanic student body, and finds he has a lot to learn about their lives. When he discovers many of his pupils have a talent for running, he forms an athletics team and leads them to glory. Fact-based drama, starring Kevin Costner and Ramiro Rodriguez.(n)

programme.title: Cruel Intentions
programme.desc: A spoilt wealthy teenager challenges her equally cruel stepbrother to seduce a newcomer at their school, who has pledged to remain a virgin until she marries. The practised charmer agrees to the task - especially since his stepsister has offered to sleep with him if he succeeds - only to find himself falling in love. Drama based on Dangerous Liaisons, with Ryan Phillippe, Reese Witherspoon, Sarah Michelle Gellar and Selma Blair.(n)

programme.title: Straight Outta Compton
programme.desc: Biopic of hip hop group NWA, examining their rise to fame in the 1980s. The five members of the group drew inspiration from their anger at the dangerous world they saw around them, producing hard-hitting songs about urban life that redefined a musical genre. Starring O'Shea Jackson Jr, Corey Hawkins, Jason Mitchell, Neil Brown Jr and Aldis Hodge.(n)

programme.title: Risen
programme.desc: A Roman officer and his assistant are charged with investigating what became of Jesus' body following the crucifixion, as the Roman hierarchy fears stories of a resurrected Messiah may lead to an uprising in Jerusalem. However, what they discover during their search forces them to question everything they believe. Biblical drama, starring Joseph Fiennes and Tom Felton.(n)

programme.title: The Spiderwick Chronicles
programme.desc: Life for identical twins Jared and Simon and their sister Mallory begins afresh when their mother inherits a spooky mansion. But after moving in, strange things begin to happen, and as the youngsters investigate, they discover a book that opens up a mysterious world of amazing supernatural creatures. Fantasy adventure, starring Freddie Highmore in a dual role alongside Sarah Bolger and Nick Nolte.(n)

programme.title: Hook
programme.desc: Peter Pan, who has finally grown up and is now a married lawyer with a family of his own, is whisked away by Tinkerbell to Neverland, where he must learn to fly again if he is to save his children from the clutches of Captain Hook. Steven Spielberg's fantasy adventure, with Robin Williams, Dustin Hoffman, Julia Roberts, Bob Hoskins and Maggie Smith.(n)

programme.title: Frog Games
programme.desc: The king of the land of frogs announces a major sporting event, with the promise that the overall champion will marry his daughter. The horrified princess runs away form home and disguises herself as a commoner, planning to enter the games herself and win - but she gets mixed up in the plans of an evil snake. Animated adventure, with the voices of Bella Thorne and Cameron Dallas.(n)

programme.title: The Land Before Time
programme.desc: A young brontosaurus is left alone when his mother dies, so goes off in search of a legendary valley, where food is plentiful and he will be safe. He acquires a group of new friends on his journey, who help each other to avoid predators and obstacles in their way. Animated adventure, featuring the voices of Gabriel Damon and Pat Hingle.(n)

programme.title: Cloudy with a Chance of Meatballs
programme.desc: An incompetent scientist finally invents something that works - a machine that turns water into food. When the device gets launched into the atmosphere, it has a strange effect on his town's weather, causing giant meals to fall from the sky to the delight of the residents - until it gets out of control. Animated comedy, with the voices of Bill Hader, Anna Faris and James Caan.(n)

programme.title: Chitty Chitty Bang Bang
programme.desc: Eccentric inventor Caractacus Potts rescues an old car from the scrapheap, only to discover it has magical, gravity-defying powers. Meanwhile, Baron Bomburst, the blundering ruler of Vulgaria, will do anything to get his greedy hands on it. Children's musical adventure, based on the book by Ian Fleming, starring Dick Van Dyke, Lionel Jeffries, Sally Ann Howes, Gert Frobe, Benny Hill and James Robertson Justice.(n)

programme.title: Frog Games
programme.desc: The king of the land of frogs announces a major sporting event, with the promise that the overall champion will marry his daughter. The horrified princess runs away form home and disguises herself as a commoner, planning to enter the games herself and win - but she gets mixed up in the plans of an evil snake. Animated adventure, with the voices of Bella Thorne and Cameron Dallas.(n)

Steven Spielberg's fantasy adventure, with Robin Williams, Dustin Hoffman, Julia Roberts, Bob Hoskins and Maggie Smith.(n)
